story:
Hello! I am Maeve Broome, an artist and designer from Maine. I have a small clothing company called MYFAWNWY, which specializes in experimental hand dyed textiles that I sew by hand into special garments. I am completely self-taught when it comes to my textile and clothing design and have been slowly growing MYFAWNWY over the last few years. I have recently been accepted into a competitive nine month art residency at the Textile Arts Center in Brooklyn, NY which begins September 14th of this year.

This residency will give me the tools and time to take my clothing company to the next level. I will gain business training, have a studio space and access to incredible facilities and classes, be paired with a mentor and have weekly studio visits and critiques with people in the fashion community which will strengthen my skills and help my business grow and thrive. I will be designing a new clothing collection with access to technical support, as well as having time to further explore the boundaries between fashion and art through collaboration, performance, and experimentation, pushing my work forward into a new space. The residency will finish next summer with an art show in Brooklyn where I will show my new collection and body of work.

My goal with this residency is to gain knowledge, training and a strong creative network to bring back to Maine and help grow my business. I plan on working with Maine manufacturers to produce MYFAWNWY products locally, hiring graduates from local schools, starting an internship program and working in communities to engage with our youth and our skilled crafters. We have a long history of traditional craft in Maine and I would like to create some truly special projects by collaborating with our artisans and shining a contemporary spotlight on their talents. The potential of my business plans all contribute to enlivening the local economy and helping to put Maine on the fashion and art map of the world. The artist residency at the Textile Arts Center is an incredible spring board for these goals to materialize and become a reality.

I am seeking support to pay for the tuition of the residency. I received a partial scholarship but still owe $7500 for the nine month program. I will be working a few part time jobs during the residency to pay for housing and living expenses as well as all of my art materials. I am seeking financial support to cover the tuition costs which will allow me to focus on this opportunity and make the absolute most of it.

Everyone who donates will receive a special handmade gift and a limited edition art print in the mail to express my sincere gratitude, so please provide me with your mailing address! Thank you so much for taking the time to read about my project and I wish you all the very best in your own dreams and endeavors.

Yours Truly,

Maeve

story:
Kurzbeschreibung

Der erste VW Bus mit dem Spitznamen Bulli ist eines der bekanntesten und erfolgreichsten Fahrzeuge aller Zeiten. Die aktuelle Version VW T6 hat nicht mehr viel mit dem ursprünglichen Fahrzeug gemein.

Als stellvertretender Chefredakteur von Designers Discovery treffe ich ständig auf Designer aus dem Automobilbau. Gemeinsam mit dem Chefredakteur von Designers Discovery Peter Groschupf ergab sich in einem Gespräch mit Michael Fink die Idee den Ur-Bulli auf Basis des aktuellen T6 wiederaufleben zu lassen.

Designer Michael Fink verantwortete das Design für inzwischen selbst zu Ikonen gewordenen Fahrzeugen. So stammt zum Beispiel der erste Mercedes CLS aus seiner Feder.

Auch bei einer nur teilweisen Finanzierung werden wir versuchen, das Projekt  umzusetzen. Die Perks werden in jedem Fall erfüllt. Auch wenn der Prototyp bei einer Teilfinanzierung abgespeckt ausfallen muss.

Der Finanzierungsbetrag in Dollar ermöglicht die Auszahlung der Förderung unter Umgehung von Paypal (dies ist bei Indiegogo bei EUR nicht möglich) und spart damit Gebühren. Ein Teil der anfallenden Kosten kann direkt in Dollar bezahlt werden, Wechselgebühren fallen also nicht an.

Was du uns gibst & was du bekommst

Wir wollen gemeinsam den Charakter des Ur-Bulli wieder auferstehen lassen und die Umbauteile in Kleinserie produzieren. Dabei liegt der Qualitätsanspruch aufgrund der Erfahrung und Kompetenz von Michael Fink und seinem engagierten Team von EK-Design auf Erstausrüsterniveau.

Alle beteiligten Personen sind bereit, eigene Zeit einzusetzen und tragen dabei persönliche Kosten selbst. Wir benötigen die Mittel, um das Design perfekt an das aktuelle Fahrzeug anzupassen. Dabei gilt es auch Punkte wie die optimale Luftzufuhr und Aerodynamik sicherzustellen.

Die Folgen

Derzeit wirbt VW für den aktuellen T6 mit verschiedenen Spots im Vergleich zum alten Bulli. Wer jedoch die Präsentation des neuen T6 gesehen hat und den Flair des Ur-Bulli verstanden, ist vom neuen Produkt eher enttäuscht.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UxlUchm4DzU

Außer einer zweifarbigen Lackierung gibt es keinerlei neu interpretierte Elemente am Fahrzeug, die auch nur im Ansatz die Strahlkraft des Ur-Bulli aufgreifen. Nein, der T6 ist sicher praktisch und technisch auf hohem Niveau, aber er hat nicht mehr den Charakter des Bulli.

Jede Person, die beim Anblick des Ur-Bulli kurz lächelt sollte dieses Kampagne unterstützen. Unsere Version des T6 wird es bei voller Finanzierung mindestens 50 mal geben.

Risiken & Herausforderungen

Die Herausforderungen sind enorm. Da der aktuelle T6 eine völlig andere Grundform auweist, ist es sehr anspruchsvoll das Design des Ur-Bulli auf Basis dieses Fahrzeuges aufleben zu lassen. Die aktuellen Entwürfe dazu sind noch nicht zu Ende entwickelt. Dafür benötigen wir extern einzukaufende Zeit und Kompetenzen. Sie zeigen allerdings die Richtung.

Auch der TÜV in Deutschland will gefragt werden bei einem so umfangreichen Umbau und Vieles muss zertifiziert werden. Aufgrund der Erfahrung unseres Design- Experten im Bereich Automotive sollte dies aber machbar sein.

Auch der Chefredakteur von Designers Discovery, Peter Groschupf, (www.automotive-opinion.com) verfügt als Journalist und ehemaliger Chefredakteur sowohl des BMW als auch des Mercedesmagazins über sehr hohen automobilen Sachverstand. Die AUTOZEITUNG verantwortete er ebenfalls bereits als Chefredakteur. Alle beteiligten Personen werden sich mit dieser Kampagne verknüpfen und stehen gern auch für Rückfragen bereit.

Wir sind zuversichtlich, auch Punkte wie TÜV, Luftzufuhr, Fußgängerschutz, Produktionsvorraussetzungen etc. innerhalb eines Jahres lösen zu können und  einen ersten Prototypen auf die Strasse zu bringen. Nach einem ca. 3-6 monatigem Test (je nach Verlauf und Nachbesserungsbedarf) soll dann die Kleinserie der Anbauteile produziert werden.

Wir haben dabei einen Minimal- und einen Maximalumfang exemplarisch festgelegt um auch unterschiedlichen Budgets gerecht zu werden.

Alle Einnahmen nach Abzug der tatsächlich anfallenden Kosten aus Verkauf und Sponsoring werden vollständig in das Thema Verkehrssicherheit investiert und dienen nicht persönlicher Kontofüllung.

Andere Wege, wie man helfen kann

Wir brauchen Geld um das Projekt umzusetzen, aber wir freuen uns auch über Ideen und Fähigkeiten. Materialbearbeitung, Vertrieb, Präsentationsmöglichkeiten etc. Alles ist uns herzlich willkommen. Am wichtigsten bei der Unterstützung ist uns, dass die Liebe zum Ur-Bulli vorhanden ist.

story:
Who are we?

We hail from the islands of the Caribbean and fully realize how heated the festivities can become! This, combined with the fact that we need to wave our national colors has led to our unique product offering. Our customized wood hand fans are made from some of the finest materials to ensure that you stay cool when the party gets hot! Help us spread the word at the major carnival event in North America!

Why we need your help?

As a start-up it is necessary to get our message out! The Brooklyn Museum is the center of activity for Caribbean diaspora during Labor Day Carnival celebration in Brooklyn. Events begin from Thursday September 3rd through Sunday September 6th. 
-  Registration Fee- $1000.00 (includes a 10 x 10 tent) ;
-  Vendor has to bring tables chairs extension cord for electricity etc. ;
-  Every vendor must have insurance coverage for the 4 days, 
All contributions at $25 and above will obtain a complementary fan of choice from the inventory on our website, along with a photo with our fans posted to http://www.flagfantasy.com
Note: If our target is not met then all contributions will go towards vendor registration only on the parade route.

We plan to be there

Truly an elegant and classy way to show your national colors. Enjoy your Caribbean party experience !!  When you're hot, and want to be cool about it.  

It is a major challenge for a startup to be at the major carnival events in order to promote our Flag Fans.


Risks & Challenges

Even if we cannot register as an official vendor, we plan to undertake promotional events.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute don't forget to share our campaign on your social media.

story:
The campaign is about an urgent need

for IO to sustain its space!

We, Gizem Akkoyunoğlu, Ezgi Yakın, Yunus Emre Erdoğan, Orhan Yıldız and Ahmet Hamdi Soydemir, as five artists, founded IO art space three years ago. We are all independent artists, exhibit our works in Turkey and internationally. Since 2012, we put some savings from our own earnings and got several independent supports to keep running the space.

We built IO up all alone and nowadays we struggle in paying the rent due to increase in rentals. We cannot afford the core expenses to keep the art space running and now we are under the risk to loose our venue and stop our activities.


Support us, so that we can keep up the existence of the space for emerging young art scene in the city of Izmir. In such big cities, like Izmir, it is very necessary to have independent initiatives like ours, which are very rare to find.

The immediate act after the crisis we are currently in, will be to work on obtaining permanent funding. So the campaign collects only a bridge fund which helps us to develop long-term solutions.


What is IO?

Input/Output, or IO for short, was founded in Izmir (the city that we live and work in) with the aim of providing artists with an experimental and free space that they can utilize according to their needs. It's also a meeting point where creative people with a need to share can keep in touch, a place that aims to increase the awareness of the process of creation and positively influence motivation. Open to exhibitions, artist talks, discussions, or simply any event that could provide artists with more freedom of movement; IO is an interactive and independent platform to reinforce the network of communication. 

What We Need & Why:

€ 450 for paying past 3 months rental costs - each € 150

€ 450 for paying next 3 months rental costs  - each € 150 while we'll be looking for sustainable funds

€ 100 for production support - printing costs of the coming events

More: the impact of IO in the city goes international

As the collective we are all graduated from and still doing our MFA at Dokuz Eylül Faculty of Fine Arts. Therefore the space also works as a meeting spot for students to get a close touch with alternative art programme. In 2012 we took part in TANDEM: Cultural Managers Exchange Turkey-EU Programme, which allowed us to expand our network internationally. We did our first international cooperation with Art Transparent Contemporary Art Foundation (Wroclaw), then  hosted artists, curators including from Experimental Media Lab (Saarbrücken), Chorea Theatre (Lublin), Zahrada (Banska Bystrica). We connect all those international guests to the faculty, introduce the city's cultural life, organize meetings with other cultural actors in the city. Therefore, IO creates a reciprocal experience for both international guests as well as locals to get acquainted what is going on internationally on current education system, art practices etc.  Keeping the space open has an important impact!
story_txt:
The campaign is about an urgent need 


for IO to sustain its space! 
We, Gizem Akkoyunoğlu, Ezgi Yakın, Yunus Emre Erdoğan, Orhan Yıldız and Ahmet Hamdi Soydemir, as five artists, founded IO art space three years ago. We are all independent artists,
 exhibit our works in Turkey and internationally. Since 2012, we put some savings from our own earnings and got several independent supports 
to keep running the space. 

We built IO up all alone and nowadays we struggle in paying the rent due to increase in rentals. We cannot afford the core expenses to keep the art space running and now we are under the risk to loose our venue and stop our activities. 

Support
us, so that we can keep up the existence of the space for emerging young art
scene in the city of Izmir. In such big cities, like Izmir, it is very
necessary to have independent initiatives like ours, which are very rare to
find. 

The
immediate act after the crisis we are currently in, will be to work on
obtaining permanent funding. So the campaign collects only a bridge fund which
helps us to develop long-term solutions.

What is IO?


Input/Output, or IO for short, was founded in Izmir (the city that we live and work in) with the aim of providing artists with an experimental and free space that they can utilize according to their needs. It's also a meeting point where creative people with a need to share can keep in touch, a place that aims to increase the awareness of the process of creation and positively influence motivation. Open to exhibitions, artist talks, discussions, or simply any event that could provide artists with more freedom of movement; IO is an interactive and independent platform to reinforce the network of communication. What We Need & Why: 




€ 450 for paying past 3 months rental costs - each € 150 
 € 450 for paying next 3 months rental costs  - each € 150 while we'll be looking for sustainable funds 
€ 100 for production support - printing costs of the coming events
  More: the impact of IO in the city goes international
 As the collective we are all graduated from and still doing our MFA at Dokuz Eylül Faculty of Fine Arts. Therefore the space also works as a meeting spot for students to get a close touch with alternative art programme. In 2012 we took part in TANDEM: Cultural Managers Exchange Turkey-EU Programme, which allowed us to expand our network internationally. We did our first international cooperation with Art Transparent Contemporary Art Foundation (Wroclaw), then  hosted artists, curators including from Experimental Media Lab (Saarbrücken), Chorea Theatre (Lublin), Zahrada (Banska Bystrica). We connect all those international guests to the faculty, introduce the city's cultural life, organize meetings with other cultural actors in the city. Therefore, IO creates a reciprocal experience for both international guests as well as locals to get acquainted what is going on internationally on current education system, art practices etc.  Keeping the space open has an important impact!

story:
Click here for spanish

Hello friends!

We want to make a dream come true, offering a new concept of space design which we believe will both enhance people’s leisure experience” and promote artistic values. We want to bring forth a space in which people can live with Art, surrounded by it day and night; enjoying an immersion in such beauty that it will bring an explosion to their senses.

We started this project in order to combine art and tourism by offering travellers the opportunity to stay at “La Casita del Arte” (The little house of Art). There, the fusion of its surrounding captivating landscapes...

and the art works which will decorate rooms and common spaces will certainly create a perfect environment for a personal dialog between nature, art and emotion.

It is more than a project, it is the sum of the dreams of all who compose it and those who help us implement it.

Rooms will be namedafter an artist and decorated with some of her or his works which will give them a special personality. In shared spaces we will combine a selection of the artists who will be joining us in the journey. One room will be devoted to a young talented artist, promising youngsters from schools of art or self-taught, giving them the opportunity to show their skills and ideas, not only in their works but also in the decoration of the room. We think this will help them to grow in the magical world of creation, and also by contributing to their studies.

We want our little house to be an Arts Centre, a driving force for future workshops in painting, sculpture, photography and music.

In addition we will organize events for the promotion of regional wine and cuisine, events where our guests will be able to participate in  both tasting and learning about the arts and crafts which they involve.

Travelers and friends of “La Casita del Arte”, will also have the opportunity to purchase the artworks exposed in the house. Our aim is to bring people closer to art, providing access to a wide range of art works, that they can enjoy in their everyday environment if they desire to.

To make this possible we needed a suitable environment which had to be in harmony with the art pieces it will be hosting. This is the reason we’ve chosen our old family house, a mansion, almost a century on its “shoulders”, nearly in ruins but full of good spirit and vibrations. 

Nearly in ruins...

...

And we are renovating it!

...

...

So that you can enjoy it!

We started its renovation straight afterwards and so far we have managed to build 7 rooms, all of them with private bathroom:

a spacious common-room and a kitchen:

The rooms are relatively small but cute and cozy. You can enjoy a great view from all the bedrooms, some to the mountains and some to the gardens. Over 1500 square meters of elaborated and peaceful gardens of native plants and trees will offer a great environment for guests to relax, walk, sun bathe, read or have a nice chat.

The project has needed intensive labour and expensive materials from the very start, the changes required to recover the house and transform it in such an environment have been higher than expected. So far we have invested over a 114,000 USD in the renovation process but in order to finish it we estimate the total costs will reach about 171,000 USD (145,000.00 to finish the works in the house and 26,000.00 to purchase of equipment). And that’s why we need your support for this project.

To make this happen,and offer a new way of relaxing, and enjoying beauty and culture to those who like visiting the country-side and the same time help artists and crafters promote their work, we estimate we need to raise another 49,000 USD, which when added to our remaining founds, will bring our project to life.

For those willing to make a contribution, we have also prepared a very special and exclusive plan of rewards based on the support of the artists who participate and back the project. Donors and participants will have the opportunity to receive reproductions of their artwork, customized if required by the artists themselves so they become unique pieces, signed and with a certificate of authenticity. We will make limited editions per work, all of them printed on certified high quality 100% cotton and acid-free paper.

The works that make up the rewards, have been selflessly donated by artists excited about this new road opened in a world of innovation of artistic production, but locked into old formats as to the diffusion of works and culture.

- PERKS:

- Newsletter:
We will subcribe you to our newspaper so that you are able to keep up to date with our activities. This way you may also have the opportunity to enjoy special offers made by the artists who work with us.

- Post card with special design:

We will send you a post card designed especially for La Casita del Arte and our staff agradecimeinto manuscript.

- T-shirt with our special design:

Unisex cotton shirt with a special La Casita del Arte print design.
 
- Hand-made sketchbook:

Crafted by hand for La Casita del Arte: covers with bukram cloth and beige paper.

Hand sewn with "Copt" technique.

It allows for full opening for greater comfort when drawing.

Completely hand made with a paper weighing 90gr. especially usedfor watercolor, pencil and charcoal drawing. It has covers with bukram cloth; sewn with "Coptic" technique, from ancient Egypt, which allows it to open 180 degrees giving the artist the most comfort to draw.

The art work: 
We made a special edition of this art work printed on museum quality, "fine art" paper, which is cotton and acid-free, so that when printed with pigmented color inks it can last for more 100 years. The paper bears an embossed stamp of quality . Signed and modified by the hand by the artist, it's a unique piece. Numbered limited edition of 200 units. The market value is much higher.
You can find it in alphabetical order by author:

- Author: Alvar Haro:

https://www.facebook.com/alvar.haro

Made especially for this project!!!

Work sheet: "Puede que todo tenga un sentido". 2015. Guache/paper. Measurements original work: 65 x 50 cm.


- Author: Carmen González Castro:
http://carmengonzalezcastro.jimdo.com/

Work sheet: "Teseo y el Centauro". 2015. Oil on canvas. Measurements original work: 70 x 70

cm.

Work belonging to the series "Héroes y Monstruos"

Comments about the work:

How can we turn a painting into a three-dimensional object? How can we give back its volume to a sculpture through painting? These are some of the questions that Camen González Castro tries to answer by using anamorphosis, a procedure to distort an image that moves the viewer to contemplate a painting from several points of view, not only in front of it, but also from the edge of it. There, the distortion disappears and becomes understandable. This is what happens in ‘Theseus and the Centaur’, a work inspired by Greek and Roman mythology that shows the confrontation between opposites, between heroes and monsters, where figures emerge from dark empty holes.

 

- Juan Carlos Pareja:

https://www.facebook.com/JuanCarlosPareja/photos_albums

Work sheet: "Vigilia". 2015. Oil on canvas. Measurements original works: 33 x 41 cm.

Comments about the work: trying to represent the idea of the dream world, which is far from the established order of things.

In almost all his works Pareja makes everything ready in from the center, as the central axis of an idea of transcendent order. It’s the center of gravity and the beginning of all things.

In general, a kind of childish feeling transpires but completely all sweet.

"... Why do I feel that your work is a glorious dawn after a bad night of the soul ? Love alive, the distressed beauty, the infinite and the insignificance are placed at the same level in your work and you sit us, we who look, in an uncomfortable seat supported by a disconcerting tenderness. "Virginia Torres.


- Author: Maurizio Lanzillota.
www.mauriziolanzillotta.com

Work sheet: "Encina y nube". Oil on linen. 1994. Measurements original work: 61 x 54 cm.

Author commentary: thin and semitransparent color layers, smooth shades which make the changes of color virtually undetectable to the naked eye, glazes that make the painting represents, rather than the object being depicted, the very atmosphere which separates it from the viewer. They are representations of distant memories, dreams and desires rather than portrayals of landscapes. 


- Yolanda Martínez:
https://www.facebook.com/yolandamartinezc/photos_albums


Work sheet: "Blanco". Nails and feathers on cardboard: 12,5 x 12,5 cm.

Work belonging to the serie “Iris”.

Author commentary: aggression and sweetness, the delicacy and resounding as the search for unity and balance of opposites. From that antagonism it is invited to "come out" of perceptual stagnation offering a single vision.


If you can’t participate in the project financially but you like the idea, do not worry! Help us by sending this information to your friends to show them what we are doing. This would also be a great a great contribution!

In the case we don’t obtain enough funds to complete the work, we will dedicate the funds to the promotion of art by supporting young artists,and creating fairs and exhibitions in those places where it is not easy to enjoy cultural events due to the long distances to urban centers. We will try to bring artistic activities to them not only for the enjoyment of the senses, but also to show new ways and opportunities of life.

Thanks for paying attention to our proposal, we hope you liked our project and we hope we can count on you to help us make it happen so that we can enjoy La Casita del Arte together when the time comes!


Spanish

¡Arte, Turismo y Ocio!
¡Hola amigos!

Queremos realizar un sueño ofreciendo un nuevo diseño de espacio para, de una forma innovadora, promocionar y disfrutar el arte, que se pueda convivir con él durante el día y la noche

Hemos puesto en marcha un proyecto para unir el arte al turismo, ofreciendo a los viajeros que se alojen en La Casita del Arte, un entorno en el que puedan disfrutar de la fusión de un paisaje cautivador...

con obras de arte que decorando sus habitaciones y las zonas comunes, inicien un diálogo a tres bandas entre la naturaleza, el arte y la emoción.

Es más que un proyecto, es la suma de los sueños de todos los que lo componemos y de aquellos que nos ayudan a ponerlo en marcha.

Las habitaciones se bautizarán con el nombre de un artista y se decorará con sus obras, dando así a cada una de ellas una personalidad especial, ocupando las zonas comunes con una muestra de cada uno de los que nos acompañan en este viaje.

Una de las habitaciones se dedicará a jóvenes promesas, que saldrán de entre los estudiantes del Bachillerato de Artes, a los que ayudaremos a crecer en el mágico mundo de la creación, colaborando en su formación.

Queremos que nuestro centro turístico de arte, sea un motor para la elaboración de talleres de pintura, escultura, fotografía o música...

...además de un foco cultural en el mundo del vino y la gastronomía, promoviendo catas y cursos donde los amigos que nos visiten podrán participar y aprender.

Los viajeros y amigos de La Casita del Arte tendrán también la oportunidad de adquirir los trabajos de los artistas que allí representemos. Queremos trabajar para acercarles el arte a su vida, facilitándoles el acceso a las obras para que puedan disfrutarlas en su entorno cotidiano.

Para ponerlo en práctica, queríamos un entorno adecuado, que estuviese en armonía con la belleza de las obras que expondremos y para ello escogimos nuestra antigua casa familiar, de hace cinco generaciones, casi con 100 años a cuestas y con fantasmas buenos.

Estaba en ruinas...

...

 y la estamos recuperando!

...

...

Para que podáis disfrutarla :-) !
Hemos conseguido siete habitaciones, todas con baño...

más una zona común y la cocina.

Son habitaciones pequeñas, coquetas y confortables, con vistas excelentes, unas a la montaña y las otras al jardín de pinos. Tiene más de mil quinientos metros cuadrados de jardines elaborados con la flora autóctona, en los que relajarse, pasear, tomar el sol, leer o conversar apaciblemente...

Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes.

Queremos contar con vuestro apoyo para poder ofrecer este nuevo espacio de relax, en que la belleza y la cultura se integren en nuestra vida durante nuestras escapadas en busca de nuevas emociones...

Para ello necesitamos recaudar 49.000USD, de los 171.000 que son necesarios para toda la reforma.

El proyecto tiene un coste de obra, con todas las modificaciones que requiere la recuperación de la antigua casa, de 145.800USD y la compra del equipamiento de 26.000,00 más. En total 171.000,00 USD., de los que ya hemos desembolsado más de la mitad.

Para los que os sea posible participar, hemos preparado un plan de recompensas muy especial y exclusivo, apoyado por los artistas que colaboran el proyecto, de forma que podréis recibir reproducciones de sus obras de arte,  firmadas y modificadas una a una por los propios artistas, convirtiéndolas en piezas únicas, de gran valor, con certificado de autenticidad, series numeradas y limitadas en unidades; impresas con calidad museo en papel libre de ácidos y base de algodón y con sello de calidad gofrado.

Las obras que conforman las recompensas, las han donado desinteresadamente artistas ilusionados por este nuevo camino abierto en un mundo innovador en las producciones artísticas, pero encasillado en antiguos formatos en cuanto a la difusión de las obras y la cultura.

- RECOMPENSAS!!!
- Newsletter:
Te incluiremos en nuestro listado de suscriptores de newsletter para que te mantengas al día de nuestras actividades y para que puedas tener la oportunidad de aprovechar las ofertas especiales que hacemos de la mano de los artistas que colaboran con nosotros.

- Tarjeta postal con nuestro diseño especial y agradecimiento:

Te enviaremos una tarjeta diseñada especialmente para La Casita del Arte y con nuestro agradecimeinto personal manuscrito.

- Camiseta unisex con nuestro diseño personal:

Camiseta de algodón unisex con el diseño especial de La Casita del Arte impreso.

- Cuaderno artesano de dibujo:

Hecho a mano para La Casita el Arte: tapas con tela bukram y papel beige.

Cosido a mano con técnica "copta".

Que permite una apertura total para la mayor comodidad al dibujar.

Totalmente realizado a mano, con papel de 90gm. especial para dibujo con acuarela, lápiz y carboncillo. Tiene pastas con tela bukram; cosido con técnica "copta", del antiguo Egipto, que permite que se abra 180º para dar al dibujante plena capacidad de trabajo al hacerlo con absoluta comodidad.


Las obras de arte:

Hemos hecho para vosotros una "edición" de obras de arte para daros un excluclusivo y especial trabajo de arte: impresas en calidad museo, sobre papel "fine arte", de lgodón y libre de ácidos, que impreso con tintas igmentadas garantiza una durabción de más de 100 años sin alteración en los colores.  El papel lleva un sello de calidad gofrado y las impresiones has sido modificadas a mano por el artista para convertirla en una pieza única. Se imprimen en una edición numerada y limitada a 200 unidades, con certificado de autencidad, con un valor de mercado muy superior al aportado para la recompensa.

Podéis encontrar los trabajos en orden alfabético por autor:

- Autor: Alvar Haro:

https://www.facebook.com/alvar.haro

Hecha expresamente para este proyecto!!!

Ficha técnica del cuadro: "Quizás todo tenga un sentido". 2015. Gouache/papel. Medidas obra original: 65 x 50 cm.


- Autora: Carmen González Castro:

http://carmengonzalezcastro.jimdo.com/

Ficha técnica del cuadro: "Teseo y el Centauro". 2015. Óleo sobre lienzo. Medidas obra original: 70 x 70 cm.

Obra perteneciente a la serie "Héroes y Monstruos"

Comentarios sobre la obra:

¿Cómo hacer de un cuadro un objeto tridimensional? ¿Cómo devolver a la escultura su volumen desde la pintura? Estas son las cuestiones a las que Carmen González Castro intenta dar respuesta utilizando la anamorfosis, un procedimiento de deformación de las imágenes que obliga a contemplar el cuadro desde varios puntos de vista, frontalmente, pero también desde el margen del cuadro, donde la deformación desaparece y se hace legible. Así sucede en Teseo y el Centauro, una obra inspirada en la mitología y la antigüedad clásica que ilustra el enfrentamiento entre opuestos, entre héroes y monstruos, donde las figuras parecen emerger de profundos agujeros oscuros de vacío en la pared blanca.


- Autor: Juan  Carlos Pareja:

https://www.facebook.com/JuanCarlosPareja/photos_albums

Ficha técnica del cuadro: "Vigilia". Oleo sobre lienzo. Medidas obra original: 33 x 41 cm. 

Reseña del autor: Trata de representar la idea del mundo de los sueños, que lejos está del orden establecido de las cosas.

En casi todas las obras que Pareja realiza aparece todo dispuesto desde el centro, como eje vertebrador de una idea de orden trascendente. Centro de gravedad e inicio de todas las cosas.

De forma general, se trasluce una especie de sentimiento infantil pero no acaba de ser del todo dulce.

“...¿Porqué siento que tu obra es un glorioso amanecer después de una mala noche del alma?. El amor vivo, la belleza angustiada, lo infinito y la intrascendencia se colocan al mismo nivel en tu obra y nos sientas, a los que miramos, en un asiento incómodo apoyados en una ternura desconcertante”. Virginia Torres


- Autor: Maurizio Lanzillota:

www.mauriziolanzillotta.com

Ficha técnica del cuadro: "Encina y Nube". Óleo sobre lino. 1994. Medidas obra original: 61 x 54 cm.

Reseña del autor: Capas delgadas y semitransparentes de color, tonos suaves que hacen que los cambios de color prácticamente indetectable a simple vista, esmaltes que hacen que la pintura represente, en lugar del objeto que dibuja, la misma atmósfera que lo separa del espectador. Son representaciones de recuerdos lejanos, sueños y deseos en lugar de representaciones de paisajes.


- Yolanda Martínez:
https://www.facebook.com/yolandamartinezc/photos_albums


Ficha ténica del cuadro: "Blanco". Clavos y plumas sobre cartón entelado. Medidas obra original: 12,5 x 12,5 cm.

Obra perteneciente a la serie “Iris”.

Reseña del autor: agresión y dulzura, lo delicado y lo rotundo como búsqueda de unidad y de equilibrio en los contrarios. Desde ese antagonismo se invita a “salir” del estancamiento perceptual que ofrece una sola visión.


Si no puedes colaborar económicamente, ¡no te preocupes! Si el proyecto te gusta, envíales la información a tus amigos y enséñales lo que estamos haciendo. ¡También es una gran aportación y te estaremos igualmente agradecidos!

En el caso de que no consiguiésemos los fondos suficientes para completar la obra, dedicaríamos vuestras aportaciones igualmente a la promoción del arte, apoyando a la formación de los estudiantes, la creación de ferias y exposiciones en lugares alejados de los grandes centros urbanos, procurando acercarles actividades artísticas no solo para el disfrute de los sentidos, sino también para mostrar nuevos caminos y oportunidades de la vida.

¡Esperamos que el proyecto o guste y contamos vosotros para disfrutarlo juntos!

¡Muchas gracias por ayudarnos a realizar un sueño!

established order of things.

In almost all his works Pareja makes everything ready in from the center, as the central
axis of an idea of transcendent order. It’s the center of gravity and the beginning
of all things.
In general, a kind of childish feeling transpires but completely all sweet.
"... Why do I feel that your work is a glorious dawn after a bad night of
the soul ? Love alive, the distressed beauty, the infinite and the
insignificance are placed at the same level in your work and you sit us, we who
look, in an uncomfortable seat supported by a disconcerting tenderness.
"Virginia Torres.

- Author: Maurizio Lanzillota.www.mauriziolanzillotta.com

Work sheet: "Encina y nube". Oil on linen. 1994. Measurements original work: 61 x 54 cm.


Author commentary: thin and semitransparent color layers, smooth shades which
make the changes of color virtually undetectable to the naked eye, glazes that
make the painting represents, rather than the object being depicted, the very
atmosphere which separates it from the viewer. They are representations of
distant memories, dreams and desires rather than portrayals of landscapes. 
- Yolanda Martínez:https://www.facebook.com/yolandamartinezc/photos_albums



Work sheet: "Blanco". Nails and feathers on cardboard: 12,5 x 12,5 cm. Work belonging to the serie “Iris”.
Author commentary: aggression and sweetness, the delicacy and resounding as the search for unity and balance of opposites. From that antagonism it is invited to "come out" of perceptual stagnation offering a single vision.


If you can’t
participate in the project financially but you like the idea, do not worry! Help us by sending
this information to your friends to show them what we are doing. This would also
be a great a great contribution!In the case we don’t obtain enough funds to complete the work, we will dedicate
the funds to the promotion of art by supporting young artists,and creating
fairs and exhibitions in those places where it is not easy to enjoy cultural
events due to the long distances to urban centers. We will try to bring
artistic activities to them not only for the enjoyment of the senses, but also
to show new ways and opportunities of life.
Thanks for paying attention to our proposal, we hope you liked our
project and we hope we can count on you to help us make it happen so that we can
enjoy La Casita del Arte together when the time comes!
 
 Spanish

¡Arte, Turismo y Ocio!



¡Hola amigos!

Queremos realizar
un sueño ofreciendo un nuevo diseño de espacio para, de una forma innovadora,
promocionar y disfrutar el arte, que se pueda convivir con él durante el día y
la noche
Hemos puesto
en marcha un proyecto para unir el arte al turismo, ofreciendo a los viajeros
que se alojen en La Casita del Arte, un entorno en el que puedan disfrutar de
la fusión de un paisaje cautivador...

con obras de arte que decorando sus
habitaciones y las zonas comunes, inicien un diálogo a tres bandas entre la
naturaleza, el arte y la emoción.

Es más que un proyecto, es la suma de los sueños de todos
los que lo componemos y de aquellos que nos ayudan a ponerlo en marcha. 

Las
habitaciones se bautizarán con el nombre de un artista y se decorará con sus
obras, dando así a cada una de ellas una personalidad especial, ocupando las
zonas comunes con una muestra de cada uno de los que nos acompañan en este
viaje.Una de las
habitaciones se dedicará a jóvenes promesas, que saldrán de entre los
estudiantes del Bachillerato de Artes, a los que ayudaremos a crecer en el
mágico mundo de la creación, colaborando en su formación.
Queremos que
nuestro centro turístico de arte, sea un motor para la elaboración de talleres
de pintura, escultura, fotografía o música...


...además de un foco cultural en el
mundo del vino y la gastronomía, promoviendo catas y cursos donde los amigos
que nos visiten podrán participar y aprender. 

Los viajeros
y amigos de La Casita del Arte tendrán también la oportunidad de adquirir los
trabajos de los artistas que allí representemos. Queremos trabajar para
acercarles el arte a su vida, facilitándoles el acceso a las obras para que puedan
disfrutarlas en su entorno cotidiano.
Para ponerlo
en práctica, queríamos un entorno adecuado, que estuviese en armonía con la
belleza de las obras que expondremos y para ello escogimos nuestra antigua casa
familiar, de hace cinco generaciones, casi con 100 años a cuestas y con
fantasmas buenos. 
Estaba en ruinas...


...
 y la estamos recuperando!...




...


Para que podáis disfrutarla :-) !Hemos conseguido
siete habitaciones, todas con baño...
más una zona común y la cocina. 

Son
habitaciones pequeñas, coquetas y confortables, con vistas excelentes, unas a
la montaña y las otras al jardín de pinos. Tiene más de mil quinientos metros
cuadrados de jardines elaborados con la flora autóctona, en los que relajarse,
pasear, tomar el sol, leer o conversar apaciblemente...


Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes.
Queremos
contar con vuestro apoyo para poder ofrecer este nuevo espacio de relax, en que
la belleza y la cultura se integren en nuestra vida durante nuestras escapadas en
busca de nuevas emociones...
Para ello
necesitamos recaudar 49.000USD, de los 171.000 que son necesarios para toda la
reforma. 
El proyecto tiene
un coste de obra, con todas las modificaciones que requiere la recuperación de la antigua
casa, de 145.800USD y la compra del equipamiento de 26.000,00 más. En total 171.000,00
USD., de los que ya hemos desembolsado más de la mitad.
Para los que
os sea posible participar, hemos preparado un plan de recompensas muy especial
y exclusivo, apoyado por los artistas que colaboran el proyecto, de forma que
podréis recibir reproducciones de sus obras de arte,  firmadas y modificadas
una a una por los propios artistas, convirtiéndolas en piezas únicas, de gran
valor, con certificado de autenticidad, series numeradas y limitadas en
unidades; impresas con calidad museo en papel libre de ácidos y base de algodón y
con sello de calidad gofrado. 

Las obras que conforman las recompensas, las han donado
desinteresadamente artistas ilusionados por este nuevo camino abierto en un
mundo innovador en las producciones artísticas, pero encasillado en antiguos
formatos en cuanto a la difusión de las obras y la cultura.- RECOMPENSAS!!!- Newsletter:Te incluiremos en nuestro listado de suscriptores de newsletter para que te mantengas al día de nuestras actividades y para que puedas tener la oportunidad de aprovechar las ofertas especiales que hacemos de la mano de los artistas que colaboran con nosotros.- Tarjeta postal con nuestro diseño especial y agradecimiento:Te enviaremos una tarjeta diseñada especialmente para La Casita del Arte y con nuestro agradecimeinto personal manuscrito.- Camiseta unisex con nuestro diseño personal:Camiseta de algodón unisex con el diseño especial de La Casita del Arte impreso.- Cuaderno artesano de dibujo:

Hecho a mano para La Casita el Arte: tapas con tela bukram y papel beige.


Cosido a mano con técnica "copta".

Que permite una apertura total para la mayor comodidad al dibujar.Totalmente realizado a mano, con papel de 90gm. especial para dibujo con acuarela, lápiz y carboncillo. Tiene pastas con tela bukram; cosido con técnica "copta", del antiguo Egipto, que permite que se abra 180º para dar al dibujante plena capacidad de trabajo al hacerlo con absoluta comodidad.
Las obras de arte:
Hemos hecho para vosotros una "edición" de obras de arte para daros un excluclusivo y especial trabajo de arte: impresas en calidad museo, sobre papel "fine arte", de lgodón y libre de ácidos, que impreso con tintas igmentadas garantiza una durabción de más de 100 años sin alteración en los colores.  El papel lleva un sello de calidad gofrado y las impresiones has sido modificadas a mano por el artista para convertirla en una pieza única. Se imprimen en una edición numerada y limitada a 200 unidades, con certificado de autencidad, con un valor de mercado muy superior al aportado para la recompensa.
Podéis encontrar los trabajos en orden alfabético por autor:
- Autor: Alvar Haro:


https://www.facebook.com/alvar.haro
Hecha expresamente para este proyecto!!!


Ficha técnica del cuadro: "Quizás todo tenga un sentido". 2015. Gouache/papel. Medidas obra original: 65 x 50 cm. 
- Autora: Carmen González Castro:http://carmengonzalezcastro.jimdo.com/


Ficha técnica del cuadro: "Teseo y el Centauro". 2015. Óleo sobre lienzo. Medidas obra original: 70 x 70 cm.
Obra perteneciente a la serie "Héroes y Monstruos"
Comentarios sobre la obra:

¿Cómo hacer de un cuadro un objeto tridimensional? ¿Cómo
devolver a la escultura su volumen desde la pintura? Estas son las cuestiones a
las que Carmen González Castro intenta dar respuesta utilizando la anamorfosis,
un procedimiento de deformación de las imágenes que obliga a contemplar el
cuadro desde varios puntos de vista, frontalmente, pero también desde el margen
del cuadro, donde la deformación desaparece y se hace legible. Así sucede en Teseo
y el Centauro, una obra inspirada en la mitología y la antigüedad clásica que
ilustra el enfrentamiento entre opuestos, entre héroes y monstruos, donde las
figuras parecen emerger de profundos agujeros oscuros de vacío en la pared
blanca.

- Autor: Juan  Carlos Pareja:
https://www.facebook.com/JuanCarlosPareja/photos_albums


Ficha técnica del cuadro: "Vigilia". Oleo sobre lienzo. Medidas obra original: 33 x 41 cm. 
Reseña del autor: Trata de representar la idea del mundo de los sueños, que lejos está del orden
establecido de las cosas.


En casi todas
las obras que Pareja realiza aparece todo dispuesto desde el centro, como eje
vertebrador de una idea de orden trascendente. Centro de gravedad e inicio de
todas las cosas.
De forma
general, se trasluce una especie de sentimiento infantil pero no acaba de ser
del todo dulce.
“...¿Porqué
siento que tu obra es un glorioso amanecer después de una mala noche del alma?.
El amor vivo, la belleza angustiada, lo infinito y la intrascendencia se
colocan al mismo nivel en tu obra y nos sientas, a los que miramos, en un
asiento incómodo apoyados en una ternura desconcertante”. Virginia Torres

- Autor: Maurizio Lanzillota:
www.mauriziolanzillotta.com


Ficha técnica del cuadro: "Encina y Nube". Óleo sobre lino. 1994. Medidas obra original: 61 x 54 cm.
Reseña del autor: Capas delgadas y semitransparentes de
color, tonos suaves que hacen que los cambios de color prácticamente indetectable a simple vista,
esmaltes que hacen que la pintura
represente, en lugar del objeto que dibuja, la misma atmósfera que lo separa del espectador.
Son representaciones de recuerdos lejanos, sueños y deseos en lugar de representaciones
de paisajes.
- Yolanda Martínez: https://www.facebook.com/yolandamartinezc/photos_albums


Ficha ténica del cuadro: "Blanco". Clavos y plumas sobre cartón entelado. Medidas obra original: 12,5 x 12,5 cm. 

Obra perteneciente a la serie “Iris”.
Reseña del autor: agresión
y dulzura, lo delicado y lo rotundo como búsqueda de unidad y de equilibrio en
los contrarios. Desde ese antagonismo se invita a “salir” del estancamiento
perceptual que ofrece una sola visión.

Si no puedes
colaborar económicamente, ¡no te preocupes! Si el proyecto te gusta, envíales
la información a tus amigos y enséñales lo que estamos haciendo. ¡También es
una gran aportación y te estaremos igualmente agradecidos!En el caso
de que no consiguiésemos los fondos suficientes para completar la obra,
dedicaríamos vuestras aportaciones igualmente a la promoción del arte, apoyando a
la formación de los estudiantes, la creación de ferias y exposiciones en
lugares alejados de los grandes centros urbanos, procurando acercarles
actividades artísticas no solo para el disfrute de los sentidos, sino también
para mostrar nuevos caminos y oportunidades de la vida.
¡Esperamos
que el proyecto o guste y contamos vosotros para disfrutarlo juntos!

¡Muchas
gracias por ayudarnos a realizar un sueño!

story:
The Project

For many Asian Americans the lack of visibility in the public sphere is a persistent and pervasive problem. So in commemoration of our organization's 25th anniversary, we decided to react by creating a collective mural that will claim and transform visual public space to reflect who we are and root our vibrant community. We want to honor all Asian American women in the arts of past and present while providing inspiration to future generations.


images: Artists Ka Yan Cheung, Kathy Fujii-Oka, Reiko Fujii, and Susan Almazol. Photos courtesy of Cynthia Tom, Reiko Fujii, and Lorenz Angelo Photography.

To realize our project we’ve teamed up with local and well-respected Asian American women muralists Cece Carpio (Trust Your Struggle, SF Public Arts Commission) and Erin Yoshi (Trust Your Struggle, The Estria Foundation). With their expertise, AAWAA artists and community members will envision, craft, and paint a mural befitting of our organization’s legacy.

Artwork: courtesy of Erin Yoshi.


Artwork: courtesy of Cece Carpio.

The mural will be located in the Richmond District of San Francisco, a diverse area sandwiched by Golden Gate park and the Presidio with a sizable Asian American population, including many artists, writers, musicians, and other creative makers. 


The Impact

Cultural Visibility for Asian Americans

San Francisco has long been the epicenter of Asian American life and culture. The oldest running Asian American arts nonprofit was founded here, we have the nation’s largest yearly Asian film festival , we are the birthplace of Asian American studies, and Asians make up about one third of the city’s population. And yet, there’s no Asian American public art space in San Francisco.

Commissioning this mural  is our way of commemorating AAWAA's jubilee year while claiming a physical and visual public space. We ultimately want to raise the visibility of a community that has made so many historical contributions to this city.


Public Art Improving Economic & Social Environment

Public art adds cultural value to the area, encouraging community building & visitors to the neighborhood.

Be part of the AAWAA Legacy of successfully staging art exhibitions, screenings, lectures, panel discussions, and workshops for the past 25 years.


images: underCurrents & the Quest for Space (2013), Eating Cultures (2014), Unbound Kimonos (2013), Divided Attentions: The Worlds of Bernice Bing (2014), Hungry Ghosts (2015). Courtesy of Cris Matos, Mido Lee Productions, and Lorenz Angelo Photography.


What We Need & What You Get

Contributions to this campaign will go towards:



The Perks

Limited Edition artist collectibles, unique experiences, and more! We've got something for you at any level of support.





Risks & Challenges

Our biggest challenges are securing a wall and proper funding that will ensure that we, in collaboration with our lead artists, create a mural reflective of our thriving community and that we have the proper materials to make this historical mural last.

Community Support

To make sure this project succeeds, we've reached out to the Clement Street Merchants Association and Supervisor Eric Mar to make sure the AAWAA mural will find a proper home in the Richmond District.


Other Ways You Can Help

1. Know a wall in the Richmond District that would be perfect for this mural? Let us know!

2. Help us get the word out about this historic mural project. Share this campaign and use #MuralMuses!

3. Follow us on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram to get instant updates about the project.

story:
About us:

4mamaearth is an LA based community organization founded in 2007 by Jaime Kailani Bayot, big sister to international superstar Bruno Mars. The 4mamaearth mission is to use the power of art, music and nature to make a change for the better, locally and globally. We partner with schools, universities, community centers, hospitals and more to present all ages enrichment classes & events. We have followers in more than 40 countries with chapters in Brazil, Chile, Germany, Indonesia and the Philippines with young people planting trees, cleaning up neighborhoods and collecting clothes and toys for shelters and orphanages.

About Coloring Mandalas:

Recently, we took our COLORING MANDALAS project to Loma Linda University Children's Hospital to bring coloring kits to children and families stuck in their hospital rooms and also to color along with us. 

A mandala is a spiritual symbol representing the universe. Mandalas can be found in every culture and religion. Coloring Mandalas is way to express hidden parts of yourself and explore the spiritual process as it unfolds with color and texture.

Benefits of mandalas include:
1. Relieve tension, anxiety, fear and worry
2. Relax and heal the mind, body and spirit.
3. Stimulate creative thinking and problem-solving.

It's an ancient art form for all ages!

"Art helps kids to express themselves and not focus so much on the pain", says Myra Benitez, Manager of Social Work at Loma Linda University Children's Hospital.

What We Need 

We are excited to say we have been invited back to Loma Linda University Children's Hospital and we will visit with more interactive art projects this November! We take Coloring Kits to the children that include several mandala coloring sheets, coloring tools (like pencils, crayons or markers) and a postcard insert with how-to directions.

It costs about $5 for each coloring kit. If we reach our goal, we can create 100 coloring kits! 

Our plan is to bring this project to more hospitals, shelters and place there are kids in need. The more money we raise, the more coloring kits we can provide to reach more children so please help us meet and exceed our goal!

The Impact of Art Therapy

When you contribute to this campaign, you are helping children in a profound way. Art therapy for children can provide kids with an easier way to express themselves since a young child is likely to be more comfortable expressing him/herself with some crayons and markers, for example, than he/she is going to be at expressing emotions and feelings through words. Art therapy can help children dealing with:

  • mental health problems
  • grief and/or loss 
  • learning disabilities
  • emotional problems
  • abuse of any kind
  • cancer or terminal illness

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools and tell your friends and family about our campaign!

We Thank You!

story:
THE HISTORY OF MUTABOTS

In late 2013, almost playing, and because of my work related to construction, I found among the materials around me (WOOD / IRON / ETC) forms that I start to work with, creating sculptures that I called "Mutabots". From the beginning, I liked the idea of working with recycled and reused materials for several reasons, including the issue of recycling and giving them a second chance, as well as the endless possibilities they offer me, as they are generally all different.

Over time, Mutabots began to evolve, and looking to provide a more detailed finishing, I started using obsolete electronic parts in the construction process, which is also closely associated to the problem of waste and electronic scrap, something that was fully compatible with the original idea. The result of this was the building of many more robots. By creating the Mutabots community, I started to show my work with good reviews, first among my acquaintances, and then in the social networks (FACEBOOK / TWITTER / INSTAGRAM). The reception and critics were always very good; the press received them very well, interviewing me in several occasions; and even a publisher from the USA approved the printing of a Mutabots book, in which I am currently working.

I always knew there was something more behind the Mutabots, rather than only a simple sculpture. Mutabots is in fact an art project with many facets that could be open. From the making of a book, the shooting of a film, to the creation of merchandising that could teach people how to build their own Mutabots, thus raising awareness about recycling and reuse of materials.

Each Mutabot is unique not only for its composition, but also because they have a name and personality features, which makes each of them one of a kind.

While I had inquiries from interested people trying to buy them in the near past, so far I have not sold them, as I decided to verify in which direction I want to head towards with the project. Today, almost two years later, my intention is to make the Mutabots something much more important than a sculpture. My idea is to make them associated to characters who express commitment. This commitment relates to environmental protection, recycling and appreciation of this alternative art form.

Although I decided not to sell, I have been giving lately to different personalities one Mutabot, as a personal recognition to people who excels at what they do, and in turn, they appreciate this art form with great impact and gratitude.


NEXT STEPS

• Create a website where, besides showing the characters with their new owners and record where each person has a Mutabot; visitors will be able to know the info and history of each character.

• Spread the project's essence and its social content regarding recycling and ptotecting the environment.

• Present and display Mutabots in different fairs and exhibitions.

• Finish editing the book of Mutabots.

• Launch a variety of products (eg: t-shirts/mugs) with Mutabots imagery.

• Conduct workshops where I could teach how to create art through the reuse and recycling of materials.

In short, the idea is to make Mutabots be recognized everywhere as the characters or associated with recycling and reuse. This requires more time and dedication, and my goal is to do so in the short term. Recently I was invited to participate in OXFORD INTERNATIONAL ART FAIR 2016, something I'm considering at the moment, in order to explore other paths.


WHY BE PART OF THE MUTABOTS PROJECT

Collaborating with the Mutabots project is not only an economic issue. You can "Like" or follow the Mutabots in social networks, as well as recommend a friend or acquaintance to pay attention to the project and see its possibilities. I just found, at the age of 40, an art form that also aims to raise social awareness about caring for the planet. I want to share this way of making art with the world, and that those who are lucky enough to ever have a Mutabot, know that it is not only a sculpture, because they know the story behind it.

ABOUT ME

My name is Juan Pablo González Acosta, I'm 41, I have a wife and two children, and live in Argentina. I love art since my childhood, and I've been always painting since then, making sculptures or recycling furniture. This is something I've done for a long time, where my passion is and I really feel full.

Sincerely

JUAN PABLO





HISTORIA DE LOS MUTABOTS

A fines del año 2013, casi jugando, descubro entre los materiales que me rodean por mi actividad (MADERA / HIERRO / ETC) formas que empiezo a trabajar creando unas esculturas a las que denomino “Mutabots”. Desde un principio me gustó la idea de trabajar con materiales reutilizados por varios motivos, entre ellos el tema de reciclar y darles una segunda oportunidad, como así también la infinidad de posibilidades que estos me ofrecen, ya que en general son todos distintos.

Con el tiempo los Mutabots empezaron a evolucionar, y buscando darles más detalles de terminación, incorporé en su construcción piezas de electrónica en desuso, algo que también está muy asociado la problemática de la basura y scrap electrónico, lo cual era completamente compatible con la idea original, haciendo así muchos más robots. Creando la comunidad MUTABOTS, empecé a mostrar mi trabajo con buena crítica, primero entre mis conocidos y luego en las redes sociales (FACEBOOK/TWITTER/INSTAGRAM). La recepción y crítica siempre fueron muy buenas, la prensa los recibió muy bien haciéndome varias notas, e inclusive una editorial de USA aprobó la publicación de un libro de los MUTABOTS en el cual estoy trabajando en este momento.

Siempre supe que detrás de los Mutabots había más que una escultura había un proyecto de arte y personajes con múltiples aristas para explorar, desde hacer un libro, una película, merchandising hasta enseñar a las personas a crear sus propios Mutabots y de esta forma generar conciencia sobre el reciclado y la reutilización.

Cada Mutabot es único no solo por su composición, sino porque además tienen un nombre y características de personalidad, lo que hace que sean personajes muchas veces con características y problemáticas de personas reales

Si bien he tenido e interesados en comprarlos, hasta el momento no lo hice ya que decidí ver hacia donde quería ir con el proyecto. Hoy, casi dos años después, es mi intención hacer de los Mutabots algo mucho más importante que una escultura. Mi idea es hacer de ellos personajes asociados al compromiso ambiental y de cuidado del planeta de quien lo tenga. Este compromiso se relaciona a cuidar el  medio ambiente, el reciclado y la valoración de esta forma de arte.

MUTABOTS - EL RECONOCIMIENTO

Si bien decidí no venderlos, en este tiempo he ido entregándole a diferentes personalidades Mutabot como un reconocimiento personal a gente que se destaca en lo que hace, a la pasión en lo que hacen y al compromiso y valoración de esta forma de arte con muy buena repercusión y gratitud.

PROXIMOS PASOS

·  CREAR UNA WEB DONDE, ADEMAS DE MOSTRAR LOS PERSONAJES CON SUS NUEVOS DUEÑOS Y LLEVAR UN REGISTRO DONDE CADA PERSONA QUE TENGA UN MUTABOT PUEDA SABER TODOS SUS DATOS Y LA HISTORIA DE LOS MUTABOTS.

·  DIFUNDIR LA ESCENCIA DEL PROYECTO Y SU CONTENIDO SOCIAL SOBRE EL  RECICLADO Y CUIDADO DEL MEDIO AMBIENTE EN LAS REDES SOCIALES.

·  PODER PRESENTAR Y EXHIBIR LOS MUTABOTS EN DIFERENTES MUESTRAS O FERIAS.

·  TERMINAR DE EDITAR EL LIBRO.

·  LANZAR UNA LINEA DE PRODUCTOS (REMERAS/TAZAS/CUADERNOS) CON LA IMAGEN DE LOS MUTABOTS.

·  REALIZAR TALLERES DONDE ENSEÑAR COMO CREAR ARTE MEDIANTE LA REUTILIZACION Y RECICLADO DE MATERIALES

En definitiva, la idea es poder hacer que los Mutabots sean reconocidos en todas partes como los personajes o robots de culto asociados al reciclado y la reutilización. Esto demanda tiempo y una mayor dedicación, y mi objetivo es poder hacerlo en el corto plazo.

Recientemente fui invitado a participar en la OXFORD INTERNATIONAL ART FAIR 2016, algo que estoy evaluando para explorar y abrir esto a otro nivel

POR QUÉ SER PARTE DEL PROYECTO MUTABOTS

Colaborar con el proyecto Mutabots es colaborar con un proyecto de interés social que busca mediante la creación de arte reciclando materiales y la reutilización busca, la concientización y el comprimiso de los que estamos hoy con las generaciones que vienen logrando a partir de pequeños cambios muchos beneficios

Se ser un “like” o bien seguir a los Mutabots en las redes sociales, como también recomendarle a algún amigo o conocido que le preste atención al proyecto y lo apoye.

Yo  simplemente encontré, por medio del arte una manera  de generar conciencia social sobre el cuidado del planeta. Deseo compartir y difundir este proyecto  de hacer arte con el mundo, y que aquellos que tengan la suerte de alguna vez tener un Mutabot, sepan que no es solamente una escultura, ya que conocen la historia y la que hay atrás.
story_txt:
THE HISTORY
OF MUTABOTS
In late 2013,
almost playing, and because of my work related to construction, I found among
the materials around me (WOOD / IRON / ETC) forms that I start to work with,
creating sculptures that I called "Mutabots". From the beginning, I
liked the idea of working with recycled and reused materials for several reasons,
including the issue of recycling and giving them a second chance, as well as
the endless possibilities they offer me, as they are generally all different.
Over time,
Mutabots began to evolve, and looking to provide a more detailed finishing, I
started using obsolete electronic parts in the construction process, which is
also closely associated to the problem of waste and electronic scrap, something
that was fully compatible with the original idea. The result of this was the
building of many more robots. By creating the Mutabots community, I started to
show my work with good reviews, first among my acquaintances, and then in the
social networks (FACEBOOK / TWITTER / INSTAGRAM). The reception and critics
were always very good; the press received them very well, interviewing me in
several occasions; and even a publisher from the USA approved the printing of a
Mutabots book, in which I am currently working.
I always knew
there was something more behind the Mutabots, rather than only a simple sculpture.
Mutabots is in fact an art project with many facets that could be open. From
the making of a book, the shooting of a film, to the creation of merchandising
that could teach people how to build their own Mutabots, thus raising awareness
about recycling and reuse of materials.
Each Mutabot
is unique not only for its composition, but also because they have a name and
personality features, which makes each of them one of a kind.
While I had
inquiries from interested people trying to buy them in the near past, so far I
have not sold them, as I decided to verify in which direction I want to head towards
with the project. Today, almost two years later, my intention is to make the
Mutabots something much more important than a sculpture. My idea is to make
them associated to characters who express commitment. This commitment relates
to environmental protection, recycling and appreciation of this alternative art
form.
Although I
decided not to sell, I have been giving lately to different personalities one
Mutabot, as a personal recognition to people who excels at what they do, and in
turn, they appreciate this art form with great impact and gratitude.


NEXT STEPS 
• Create a
website where, besides showing the characters with their new owners and record
where each person has a Mutabot; visitors will be able to know the info and
history of each character. 
• Spread the
project's essence and its social content regarding recycling and ptotecting the
environment.
• Present and
display Mutabots in different fairs and exhibitions. 
• Finish
editing the book of Mutabots. 
• Launch a
variety of products (eg: t-shirts/mugs) with Mutabots imagery. 
• Conduct
workshops where I could teach how to create art through the reuse and recycling
of materials.
In short, the
idea is to make Mutabots be recognized everywhere as the characters or
associated with recycling and reuse. This requires more time and dedication,
and my goal is to do so in the short term. Recently I was invited to
participate in OXFORD INTERNATIONAL
ART FAIR 2016, something I'm considering at the moment, in order to
explore other paths.




WHY BE PART OF THE MUTABOTS PROJECT
Collaborating
with the Mutabots project is not only an economic issue. You can
"Like" or follow the Mutabots in social networks, as well as
recommend a friend or acquaintance to pay attention to the project and see its
possibilities. I just found, at the age of 40, an art form that also aims to
raise social awareness about caring for the planet. I want to share this way of
making art with the world, and that those who are lucky enough to ever have a
Mutabot, know that it is not only a sculpture, because they know the story
behind it.
ABOUT ME 
My name is
Juan Pablo González Acosta, I'm 41, I have a wife and two children, and live in
Argentina. I love art since my childhood, and I've been always painting since
then, making sculptures or recycling furniture. This is something I've done for
a long time, where my passion is and I really feel full.

Sincerely
JUAN PABLO

DE LOS MUTABOTS

mi actividad (MADERA / HIERRO / ETC) formas que empiezo a trabajar creando unas

más robots. Creando la comunidad MUTABOTS, empecé a mostrar mi trabajo con

La recepción y crítica siempre fueron muy buenas, la prensa los recibió muy

story:
Introduction to the book project.

My name is Heike Schneider-Matzigkeit, I'm a professional photographer and magazine editor living in Berlin, Germany. I spent more than a decade living in London where I completed my University education and worked for clients such as NME, The Guardian, Neo2, The Independent and The Fortean Times amongst others. 

The photography project BERLIN REFLECTIONS – ANTLITZ BERLIN began in the spring of 2007 having moved from London to Berlin. Once settled, I started taking photographs of international female artists, living in Berlin or passing through this modern city. With this 192-page colour hardcover art photo book, I would like to present a selection of photographs of more than 60 female artists taken over a time period from 2007 to 2015.

The photographic art book BERLIN REFLECTIONS – ANTLITZ BERLIN explores the artistic underground of modern day Berlin, documenting the international female creatives drawn to the city, from visual artists to contemporary dancers, from musicians to burlesque artists and performers.

Photographed in my artist studio in Prenzlauer Berg, Berlin I employed black surroundings and artfully arranged studio lighting in order to highlight the individual’s beauty and gain a look beyond their exterior. I am looking to achieve intimate portraits that allow the viewer to get a sense of the person, of their character. This means the models needed to relax and allow me take a look into their world...

I have always been interested in and inspired by the art, style and culture of the 1920s. With this project, I also wanted to evoke the feeling and spirit of Berlin in the 1920s - the glamorous Weimar Berlin era and its flapper culture. 

I have decided to crowdfund this book as I wanted to keep control over all aspects, from editing the photographs to designing the book cover and inside pages, from the printing process to the choice of paper and binding for the final product.

I am super excited to work with the artistic community as well as all art-loving people out there! I'm hoping to build new contacts and reach out to more people, locally and internationally.   

Here is what you get - The Book.

210 by 270 mm landscape format hardcover colour photo book featuring 192 pages.

Limited first edition of 500 copies, numbered and signed.

Book introduction written by Candy Clark, Oscar nominated actress and star of ‘The Man who fell to Earth’ and ‘American Graffiti’ 

Bauhaus-inspired design of each artist’s name, their profession and the year the photograph(s) were taken. 

(Having gained professional experience as a graphic designer in London, I decided to design the book cover and layout myself to present as complete a vision of the project as possible.)  

With each book order you will also receive FOR FREE one 10 by 15 cm high-gloss professional photo print featuring one of the below Preview book photos - Ginger Synne, Evilyn Frantic, Giuditta Sin, Mollie Black, Lula Rose, Lada Redstar.

Here is a selection of the artists and performers featured in the book: Jessie Evans, Lada Redstar, Dana Popp, Julietta La Doll, Shari Inessa B., Lula Rose, Larissa Domin, Lydia Johanna, Valentina Belli, Scarlett Martini, Valentina DeMonia, Viv Dee, Sophie Julie, Giuditta Sin, Naomi Fearn, Mad Kate, Agata D'Mon, Jaike Jensen, Nina Wagner, Anastasia Atapin, Pippa the Ripper, KT van Stone, Annina Nusko, Ginger Synne, Hana Lee Erdman, Margaret Lamour, Mollie Black, Jewels Good, Eyleen Kibwebwe, Carolina Rupp, Carole Ruault, La Rubinia, Rebecca Halls, Sarah Josephine, Doria Gray, Tara la Luna, Mopsy Meyers, Tronicat la Miez, Jessica Drew, Sydney la Faire, Honey Lulu, Mignon, Shan Wang, Galina Andreeva, Gabrielle Miller, Mireia Salip, Tara Meyer, Vega Vargas, Marlene von Steenvag, Maja Fritzon, Evilyn Frantic, La Viola Vixen, Carolina Bavio, Kyrie Maezumi, Johanna Platow Sadonis, Xarah von den Vielenregen, Dyan Valdes, Billie Rae, Hurricane Irina, Cara Celine, Pepper Potemkin.



I have chosen to work closely with a highly renowned printer based in the South of Germany. Excitingly, a new printing technique called UV LED technology will be employed for the book which renders the images more bright on the page and is also more environmentally friendly due to the dyes used. The book pages will be glued as well as stitch-bound for easier turning of pages and better viewing of the photographs.

Perks! 

With each book order you will also receive FOR FREE one 10 by 15 cm high-gloss professional photo print featuring one of the following Preview book photos - Ginger Synne, Evilyn Frantic, Giuditta Sin, Mollie Black, Lula Rose, Lada Redstar.

Preview Book Photos to choose from: 


Up for grabs are also the above photographs as limited A4 high-gloss photographic prints featuring artists such as Lada Redstar and Mollie Black, hand-signed by the individual performer! 

See below for hand-signed print by Evilyn Frantic (print arrives without the frame).

Available are: Ginger Synne, Evilyn Frantic, Giuditta Sin, Mollie Black, Lada Redstar.

The campaign is run to raise funds for the book printing costs, the purchase of the ISBN number, Indiegogo and Paypal fees, printing of flyers and photographs, package and shipping fees.

Risks & Challenges.

In years to come this book will hopefully present an interesting and beautiful snapshot of our time, and the artistic underground of this modern city. It would be great if you decide to be a part of this and help bring the project to life!

I will be posting updates about the progress of the book as well as more photographs to be included, printing news, posting schedule etc.

I will do my outmost to have the book and perks ready and delivered in time for Christmas!

Other ways to help.

If you like the project, please help to spread the word about this exciting new book!

Thank you!

story:
Short Summary

The Homestead Jazz, Blues & Arts Festival is sponsored by ANEW Community Institute,  a nonprofit organization that provides community education and services democratically decided by its membership. Creating jobs, starting businesses and non-profits, community education, stopping foreclosures and morale building with creative enterprises is ANEW's mission.   ARTS ANEW, a juried art exhibition, extends the scope of the festival this year. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • ART ANEW needs $1500 to transform the ground floor of the historic Baker House, into a handsome gallery space.  Walls need to be painted and picture hanging rails installed, among other things.
  • I, Elizabeth Asche Douglas of Douglas Art Gallery, am overseeing the exhibition project. Giclee prints of my award-winning art  are offered as perks for designated donations. The photo above shows part of an exhibition I curated for the Pittsburgh Cultural Trust at Gallery 709 Penn in 2013. 
  • All funds received will be used for the designated purpose of preparing an attractive gallery space. YOUR CONTRIBUTION IS TAX DEDUCTIBLE.

The Impact

Homestead has a rich cultural heritage, but it is one of the "Rust Belt" communities hard-hit by the decline of steel in the Pittsburgh, PA region.  ANEW Community Institute is passionately working for renewal and resurgent vitality in this historic community.

  • We call on you who recognize the role of the arts in building the morale of a community to help bring this exhibition about.
  • I have had considerable experience in directing and curating art exhibitions and festivals: Geneva College, Sweetwater Center for the Arts, Pittsburgh Center for the Arts, etc.

Risks & Challenges

Fundraising is always dependent on assuring potential givers that the cause is worthy and will be of benefit to them.  We have trust in those we ask, and hope you will find us worthy of your trust.

  • "Stick-to-it-iveness" is the prime quality for meeting a goal.
  • Our plan is to be clear and decisive, as well as open to suggestions you might offer.

Other Ways You Can Help

There are more ways to give than monetarily . . .

  • Bang the drum loudly, and march with us to show the world, that down is not out. Volunteers will be wildly welcomed.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools! ASK OTHERS TO CONTRIBUTE.

.
