story:
WHAT?

Colour is the root of her work, corresponding with a variety of materials that can create responsive effects to the emotions and memories. She allows the paint to flow and burst out onto the surface to bring assertive juxtapositions of colours into abstract compositions with the specialty of different brushes and tools. Her practice focuses on to make pictures that the viewers do not see all at once and allow them to discover something new every time they look at it, through their imagination and personal experience.

 

Seeing materiality as a significant component in her work, Celeste employs material that aims to go beyond the recognisable connotation of the material itself and to reveal the unknown within the familiar objects that are used on daily basis. On the first attempt to mirrored surface in her practice, she intends to capture the ambivalence that people feel about aspects of their personal identity, narrating the distance between the way that the viewers see themselves and the way others see them. Adapting the idea of Duchamp which was usually paraphrased as ‘the viewers complete the work.’, Celeste realised the importance of the relationship and tension between her work and the viewers. Considering her work and the viewers as a dialogue, she provides the opportunity to communicate and react between themselves within the space. Her work is inviting and encouraging the viewer to encounter, to navigate the space and to make a subjective contribution. To further visualise the experiences, she investigates into the nature of light, space and perception that manifest in objects, sculptures and photography.

 

WHY?

As you may already know, I am currently doing a MA Fine Art course at the University for the Creative Arts in the UK. Aside from examining the relationship between my work with historical, societal and political contexts in critical perspectives through a variety of creative projects, it also allows me to position my practice within a professional context by situating my work within the art world. To develop skills on identifying appropriate external spaces, networking, social media, curation, arts funding and articulating practice to the audience, I decided to hold a mixed-media art exhibition in London!

 

In order to bring MY 1ST SOLO EXHIBITION to life in London! I NEED YOUR SUPPORT!

 

Here I'm asking if you can contribute a little to help me to achieve the best result possible. Don't worry if you're not able to, it's absolutely fine! I would be more than grateful if you could share the campaign to reach everyone around!

 

A BIG THANK YOU IN ADVANCE!

Interested to know further on how will the budget be allocated, please go to FAQ.

 

WHO?

Celeste C. da Luz (1992) was born and raised in Macau. She received a BA in Communication (Creative Media) from the University of Macau (2015) and is currently doing a MA in Fine Art at the University for the Creative Arts in the UK. She is one of the selected artists in the project ‘In the Studio’ (2018-2019) of the Mall Galleries, London. Celeste was awarded Top Prize in the Lifted\\18: Art Competition (2018) and has received The ESOP Newman Young Artist Scholarship (2019) from The Essential School of Painting, London.

 

Her work have been featured in exhibitions including Pint Sized (The Brewery Tap, Folkestone, 2019), Lifted\\18: Art Competition Exhibition (Genesis Cinema, London, 2019), AFA Autumn Salon (Fundação Oriente, Macau, 2018) and Showcase: Solar Term Series – Autumn (Terra Coffee House, Macau, 2018). Upcoming exhibitions and events include UCA MA Fine Art Symposium (UCA Farnham), Surrey Artists’ Open Studio 2019 (Surrey), UCA MA Fine Art Group Show (The Biscuit Factory, London),  ‘In the Studio’ Group Show (Mall Galleries, London) The ESOP End of Year Show (The Art Pavilion, London) and UCA MA Fine Art Graduation Show (UCA Farnham). She will also participate in the International Artist Residency of Hop Projects in Folkstone, UK (2019) and Zaratan Arte Contemporânea in Lisbon, Portugal (2020).

 

Interested to see more of Celeste's work please visit www.celestecdaluz.com and on Instagram @celestecdaluz !

 

WHEN?

2 - 7 May 2019

10am - 5pm

Private View: 2 May 2019, 6 - 8.30pm

 

WHERE?

A-side B-side Gallery

352 Mare Street

Hackney London

E8 1HR

+44(0) 20 8533 7258

info@asidebsidegallery.com

www.asidebsidegallery.com
story_txt: WHAT?Colour is the root of her work, corresponding with a variety of materials that can create responsive effects to the emotions and memories. She allows the paint to flow and burst out onto the surface to bring assertive juxtapositions of colours into abstract compositions with the specialty of different brushes and tools. Her practice focuses on to make pictures that the viewers do not see all at once and allow them to discover something new every time they look at it, through their imagination and personal experience. Seeing materiality as a significant component in her work, Celeste employs material that aims to go beyond the recognisable connotation of the material itself and to reveal the unknown within the familiar objects that are used on daily basis. On the first attempt to mirrored surface in her practice, she intends to capture the ambivalence that people feel about aspects of their personal identity, narrating the distance between the way that the viewers see themselves and the way others see them. Adapting the idea of Duchamp which was usually paraphrased as ‘the viewers complete the work.’, Celeste realised the importance of the relationship and tension between her work and the viewers. Considering her work and the viewers as a dialogue, she provides the opportunity to communicate and react between themselves within the space. Her work is inviting and encouraging the viewer to encounter, to navigate the space and to make a subjective contribution. To further visualise the experiences, she investigates into the nature of light, space and perception that manifest in objects, sculptures and photography. WHY?As you may already know, I am currently doing a MA Fine Art course at the University for the Creative Arts in the UK. Aside from examining the relationship between my work with historical, societal and political contexts in critical perspectives through a variety of creative projects, it also allows me to position my practice within a professional context by situating my work within the art world. To develop skills on identifying appropriate external spaces, networking, social media, curation, arts funding and articulating practice to the audience, I decided to hold a mixed-media art exhibition in London! In order to bring MY 1ST SOLO EXHIBITION to life in London! I NEED YOUR SUPPORT! Here I'm asking if you can contribute a little to help me to achieve the best result possible. Don't worry if you're not able to, it's absolutely fine! I would be more than grateful if you could share the campaign to reach everyone around! A BIG THANK YOU IN ADVANCE!Interested to know further on how will the budget be allocated, please go to FAQ. WHO?Celeste C. da Luz (1992) was born and raised in Macau. Upcoming exhibitions and events include UCA MA Fine Art Symposium (UCA Farnham), Surrey Artists’ Open Studio 2019 (Surrey), UCA MA Fine Art Group Show (The Biscuit Factory, London),  ‘In the Studio’ Group Show (Mall Galleries, London) The ESOP End of Year Show (The Art Pavilion, London) and UCA MA Fine Art Graduation Show (UCA Farnham). She will also participate in the International Artist Residency of Hop Projects in Folkstone, UK (2019) and Zaratan Arte Contemporânea in Lisbon, Portugal (2020). Interested to see more of Celeste's work please visit www.celestecdaluz.com and on Instagram @celestecdaluz ! WHEN?2 - 7 May 201910am - 5pmPrivate View: 2 May 2019, 6 - 8.30pm WHERE?A-side B-side Gallery352 Mare StreetHackney LondonE8 1HR+44(0) 20 8533 7258info@asidebsidegallery.comwww.asidebsidegallery.com

story:
We're giving you an opportunity to "buy it forward" and save, Support our campaign and you can receive a discounted gift card that can be used for future purchases.  You can use your gift card for gifts: Christmas, Valentine's Day, Mother's Day, Birthdays.

You can save money on: back-to-school backpacks, Halloween tote bags, sweatshirts for fall, snow boots or for one of the 300 products waiting to be added to the website,

Art is life. Life is art.

We have completed a full-scale trial run (known in 'tech speak' as a "beta test") and are investing the time, effort and money into applying what we have learned.

I was an IT consultant until I was hit head-on by a woman who was texting-while-driving (don't do that) and then diagnosed with Ehlers Danlos Syndrome and then some "we don't know" neurological condition that causes seizures. I can't drive and have trouble walking and can't do what I used to do for a living. 

While I was recovering, many museums released high-resolution digital versions of their collections into the public domain in order to make that art available to as large an audience as possible.It occurred to me that I could earn a living by filling the world with Van Goghs and Rembrandts,

I started building that place on the web.

 

What we need, why we need it & what you get

The art takes up a great deal of space and requires very high-performance hosting. It's an expensive site to keep running. Tuning its back-end performance requires some advanced custom-programming. The front-end performance needs some enhancements that also require some custom-programming.

People have to know that the website exists or there's no point in doing this and advertising is expensive. 

Meeting our campaign goal will let us keep the lights on and improve the site to make it a bit more user-friendly. Fundraising will continue beyond the goal and those funds will all be used for advertising.

story:
About me:

My name is Jeff Dambrosio, but most of you probably know me as Jeff the Magic Man. I've had a strong passion for the arts and entertaining ever since I was young. From twisting balloon creations to entertaining children with magic, I put everything I have into what I do. This will be my largest project to date and I would love to share it with you!



With your support:

My team and I will build a life size re-creation of a 1950's style diner. This project will measure 30 feet long, 25 feet wide, 10 feet tall. It will take three days to build and use over 4,000 balloons. After the exhibit is built, it will be open to the public for FREE. A portion of the funds raised will be donated to the Challenger Baseball League of Syracuse.

2015 Balloon Exhibit: Taking a Ride on the Erie Canal


What is the funding for?

Due to the size of this project, we will need to upgrade our balloon inflation system. The upgraded system will include an electric inflator unit designed specifically for balloons. It will have a timing feature to ensure accurate measurements and will greatly increase our efficiency. With your contribution, my team and I will create a FREE family fun art exhibit for all of Central New York to enjoy!


You should back this project because...

You will be helping to bring a new style of art and culture to Central New York. Art plays a important role in our society. Music, literature, cinema, poetry, paintings, stage performances, and other forms of creative expression make our world come alive!

I also believe that it is important to support community organizations that provide children with an environment where they can express themselves and to make new friends. That is why I will be donating a portion of the funds raised for this project to the Syracuse Challenger Baseball League. For more information on their organization, visit www.SyracuseChallengersBaseball.com


Other ways you can help

We appreciate your support in helping us bring this public art project to life! Please SHARE this campaign on Facebook to help spread the word. Click the buttons below to share this and use the hashtag #CNYBalloonArt

story:
WHO WE ARE

A SHIP IN THE WOODS Foundation (WSOHOIDPS) is a 501(c)3 non-profit art entity working to engage elevated dialogues in art and culture within a domestic setting. We've hosted 53 cultural events since our inception and have worked with over 80 artists who have participated in our residency program. We have 5 years of documentation on our website (www.shipinthewoods.com). These events, the residency program, and other shared initiatives are the primary components in WSOHOIDPS's platform for supporting a community of artists, scientists, designers, musicians, filmmakers, writers, researchers and other creatives dedicated to advancing an ever evolving experience of our world. Our diverse programming gives these innovative thinkers a place to share and discuss alternative ideas across multi-disciplinary studies. We give the community an opportunity to discuss new paradigms of thought outside of typical box galleries and institutions.

In the fall of 2010, a group of artists and creative professionals sought out residency in a mid-century home in the hills of Del Mar, CA with the notion of creating a community driven hub for art and culture.  Set on an acre of densely vegetated land, the house presented an opportunity to have these discussions in a unique setting and after a substantial renovation project, the property was transformed into a venue worthy of displaying world-class works from both established and up-and-coming artists.

A SHIP IN THE WOODS Foundation transpired organically through artist participation which encouraged the founding of our nonprofit in 2013. Out of the success of our events, residency program and demand from our community to continue supporting local innovative thinkers, we became a 501(c)3 nonprofit. 

Today A SHIP IN THE WOODS continues to function as a home and venue for art, music, lectures, communal dinners, and various gatherings in pursuit of critical discourse. 

While a pending future location is still undetermined the WSOHOIDPS mission remains steadfast and on course - building a community and platform to support artists, scientists, designers, and other cultural researchers as they extend their own creative visions into the physical world.


ANCHORS UP

Recently the owners announced the demolition date of the house. After a 5 year sail, we're sad to announce the sinking of our Lugano vessel.  She was a mighty ship and will be missed.  No need for lifejackets just yet!  We're in the process of finding a new home for A SHIP IN THE WOODS, one worthy of charting even greater waters, but we need your help. We have until July 31st to relocate. Reaching our goal of $100,000 will aid in the transition of Ship 2.0.

We will use the money for the following: stipends for artists, developing our residency program, small amount of pay for some of our volunteers, defray some daily operations costs, shipping and handling of artwork, transportation costs, educational material, and marketing.


WHAT YOUR HELP SUPPORTS

Residency Program: The residency provides a free space for innovative thinkers or anyone working on contemporary issues, a space to think and work on projects or use the time to discuss their message and ideas with the public that is vital for cultural change.

Events: We host group art exhibitions, film screenings, musical performances, writers, researchers, happenings and other cultural discussions regarding the world as we know it. 

Collaborations: We encourage interdisciplinary collaborations which are often created through connections made at our events.  


Our small staff of three relies on the contributions of volunteers and student volunteers who receive school credit for their participation. In exchange for their help in managing our events, they are given the opportunity to connect and interact with some of the best minds and cultural leaders in our community. The programming for many of our past events directly acknowledges current cultural and social debates, regarding sustainability, climate change, gender equality and many more urgent topics of discussion. We've exhibited grad students, and professors from many major local universities, including HELM, a series of solo exhibitions curated by UCSD PhD candidate Lara Bullock. We have participated in ARTSD'14, San Diego's premiere art fair in Balboa Park. Our installation, Rhodopsin, was a featured exhibition and collaborative project that featured student architects from the New School of Architecture and Design, SALK researcher John Reynolds, musician Greg Smaller and the research of world renown Harvard vision scientist Patrick Cavanagh. We have recently met with the Cabrillo National Park Service and are in discussions to help them organize several cultural events and artist residency program later this year.


RHODOPSIN

Rhodopsin is an original, collaborative light installation organized by WSOHOIDPS (A SHIP IN THE WOODS) created for the 2014 ART SD Contemporary Art Fair and it embodies the foundation’s ongoing efforts to blur the lines between art and science. The singular art experience is a collaboration between WSOHOIDPS co-founder RJ Brooks, Salk Institute neurobiologist John Reynolds, sound artist Greg Smaller, Paradox design team from New School of Architecture+ Design, and researcher Daw-An Wu. Based on the research of Patrick Cavanagh, who studies visual phenomena, Rhodopsin aims to encourage visitors to think about the process of perception and consider the brain’s role in actively constructing, rather than simply relaying, reality. 

We appreciate all the love and contributions from fellow shipmates, friends, and volunteers over the years.  The reason why we continue and exist is because of you.  With your help we'll be able to continue these elevated dialogues and collaborations in art, science, and culture. 


Our possession of this world we have made ours is a grand larceny. And its victim is the commonwealth: the land, the genome, mother culture. We could say that property is what has been stolen from us all, or from Nature, or from God. In any event, our progressive ownership of the world naturally and inevitably accompanies our progressive estrangement from the world, so that in the end we languish in the prison of me and mine which, no matter how great our possessions, is far narrower and dingier than the unbounded Wild from whence we came."  –  Charles Eisenstein, "The Ascent of Humanity"

story:
Short Summary

My name is Sarah Werkheiser. I am an experienced illustrator who has been reveling in the joy of painting and drawing for as long as I can remember. Writing however is a love that I have only recently begun to embrace. Amazingly Made of Amazing Things is the product of combining these two passions old and new. 

Even though writing is new to my hands I have always possessed a deep love for mythology and storytelling. I believe that mythology acts as the collective dream-state of a culture, and have often felt hungry for a modern creation myth. 

Amazingly Made of Amazing Things is the product of my desire to create a new creation story that was rooted in science while still capturing the wonder and magic that permeates throughout all things.

Many have described this tale to fall somewhere in the realm of Dr Seuse meets Neil DeGrasse Tyson. 

I am extremely proud of this book, and hope that you will enjoy what it has to offer as much as I have enjoyed creating it. 

What We Need & What You Get

Your donations will go towards funding the printing and distribution of the book. 

Rewards for your support include copies of the book and original artwork by yours truly. 

Risks & Challenges

This is my first time attempting to self publish a book. I expect there to be many learning experiences lying ahead of me after printing and distributing the books for this Kickstarter, but they are challenges I am looking forward to with great anticipation.

I see no reason that I would not be able to follow through on distributing any rewards associated with this project. The only true unknown is where it will go from here.

story:
What is the Mid-South Sculpture Alliance

Mid-South Sculpture Alliance is a non-profit organization founded in 2006, dedicated to advance the creation, awareness, and understanding of sculpture in our communities. MSA is excited about our partnership with Eyedrum Art and Music Gallery and Georgia State University’s Welch School of Art and Design to hold our biggest conference yet. 

One of the most exciting aspects of the conference is the Outdoor Juried Exhibitions. MSA members have a unique opportunity to exhibit ten monumental sculptures on the Eyedrum rooftop overlooking downtown Atlanta. Many buildings rise above this rooftop offering a unique vantage to the surrounding neighborhood. 

The Welch School of Art and Design exhibition includes ten exhibition sites throughout campus. These sites will be used as a learning laboratory by students who will have the opportunity to learn through hands on experiences and discussions about the art.  

Both exhibitions will kick off with an opening during the MSA Sculpture Conference and will be on display for six months, all of which is free and open to the public. 


Help Us Bring 20 Sculptures to Downtown Atlanta through a tax-deductible donation today!

MSA needs $20,000 to make the Juried Outdoor Exhibition a reality!  MSA's number one priority is to providing a $750 honorarium to each artist selected to exhibit, but that's not where are funding needs end. A rooftop exhibition is a unique opportunity with many challenges. Installation and de-installation require a crane and forklift rental, outdoor lighting, steel plates to secure sculptures and the rental of the neighboring parking lot as a staging area.
We appreciate all donations no matter the size!  MSA feels strongly that artist compensation is vital to the future of art. In the event that we do not reach our goal of $20,000 our first priority is providing artist honorariums, and any amount under our goal will go towards the artists.  

If you are an art lover and want to help support artists and sculpture now is your chance.  YOU can be part of the team by funding sculpture and the artists that make it. Please donate today!

The Impact

The Mid-South Sculpture Conference: Outdoor Juried Exhibitions will 
  • Directly support the making of sculpture through artist honorariums 
  • Energize, enliven and create a new way to see Atlanta through engagement with sculpture in the community’s day to day environment
  • Offer unique education opportunities through guided tours offered to area middle and high schools
  • Create a learning laboratory for GSU and other University students through installation workshops and discussion opportunities

MSA has a history of working with sculptors, artists, art lovers and the public through a series of annual exhibitions and conferences, confabs and or symposiums since 2007. Venues have included Hunter Museum of American Art, Chattanooga State Community College, University of TN, University of Kentucky and Riverwalk Chattanooga. Past partners include LexArts, Public Art Chattanooga, City of Chattanooga and Hamilton County. Key note speakers and jurors have included Valerie Fletcher, Carol Mickett, Robert Stackhouse, James Surls, Jesús Moroles, Claudia DeMonte, Ed McGowin and Albert Paley.


Perks! Perks! Perks!

Donate $10 and your name will be printed in the MSA conference catalog thank you page!

Donate $25 and your name will be printed in the MSA conference catalog thank you page and receive a MSA car decal, perfect for showing of your support of art!

Donate $50 and your name will be printed in the MSA conference catalog thank you page and receive a Mid-South Conference: Atlanta 2015 poster!

Donate $75 and your name will be printed in the MSA conference catalog thank you page and receive a MSA beverage koozie, perfect for avoiding wet handshakes and warm beverages!

Donate $100 and your name will be printed in the MSA conference catalog thank you page and receive a MSA cotton duck bag, perfect for groceries, hauling your sketchbook and whatever else you can think of!

Donate $150 and  your name will be printed in the MSA conference catalog thank you page and receive the MSA swag bag! One MSA cotton duck bag loaded with the MSA car decal, beer koozie and conference poster! 

Donate $250  and your name will be printed in the MSA conference catalog thank you page and receive one free admission to all standard conference events including exhibition openings, panels, workshops and speakers! Conference is in Atlanta from September 17-20th. 

Don't want to go alone? Donate $350 your name will be printed in the MSA conference catalog thank you page and receive two free admission to all standard conference events including exhibition openings, panels, workshops and speakers! Conference is in Atlanta from September 17-20th. 

Want it all? Donate $500 and your name will be printed in the MSA catalog thank you page and receive the decal, koozie, cotton duck bag, autographed catalog, free admission for 2 to all standard conference events plus a 2 seats at the George Beasley Lifetime Achievement Dinner! 

Want to represent your business? Donate $500 and your companies name will be printed in the MSA conference catalog thank you page and your business will be highlighted in a free quarter page, camera ready ad in the MSA Sculpture Conference catalog! A great way to reach sculptors, educators and art lovers!

Need something with more impact for your business? Donate $1,000 and your companies name will be printed in the MSA conference catalog thank you page and your business will be highlighted in a free quarter page, camera ready ad in the MSA Sculpture Conference catalog! A great way to reach sculptors, educators and art lovers!


Other Ways You Can Help

We know that not everyone can contribute but you can still help support art and sculpture! Tell your friends about MSA's fundraising campaign, post it to you're social media outlets and if possible come join us for the conference in Atlanta! We would love to see you there!

Whether it is a financial donation or telling a friend about us, we can't do this without YOU!
story_txt:
What is the Mid-South Sculpture
Alliance
 
Mid-South Sculpture Alliance is
a non-profit organization founded in 2006, dedicated to advance the creation, awareness, and
understanding of sculpture in our communities. MSA is excited about our
partnership with Eyedrum Art and Music Gallery and Georgia State University’s Welch School of Art and
Design to hold our biggest conference yet. 
One
of the most exciting aspects of the conference is the Outdoor Juried Exhibitions.
MSA members have a unique opportunity to exhibit ten monumental sculptures on
the Eyedrum rooftop overlooking downtown Atlanta. Many buildings rise above
this rooftop offering a unique vantage to the surrounding neighborhood. 
The Welch School of Art and Design exhibition includes ten exhibition sites throughout campus. These sites will be used as a learning laboratory by students who will have the opportunity to learn through hands on experiences and discussions about the art.  
Both exhibitions will kick off with an opening
during the MSA Sculpture Conference and will be on display for six months, all
of which is free and open to the public. 

 Help Us Bring 20 Sculptures to Downtown Atlanta through a tax-deductible donation today! MSA needs $20,000 to make the Juried Outdoor Exhibition a reality!  MSA's number one priority is to providing a $750 honorarium to each artist selected to exhibit, but that's not where are funding needs end. A rooftop exhibition is a unique opportunity with many challenges. Installation and de-installation require a crane and forklift rental, outdoor lighting, steel plates to secure sculptures and the rental of the neighboring parking lot as a staging area.
We appreciate all donations no matter the size!  MSA feels strongly that artist compensation is vital to the future of art. In the event that we do not reach our goal of $20,000 our first priority is providing artist honorariums, and any amount under our goal will go towards the artists.  If you are an art lover and want to help support artists and sculpture now is your chance.  YOU can be part of
the team by funding sculpture and the artists that make it. Please donate
today!
  The Impact
The Mid-South Sculpture Conference: Outdoor Juried Exhibitions will 

Directly support the making of sculpture through artist honorariums 
Energize, enliven and create a new way to see Atlanta through engagement with sculpture in the community’s day to day environment
Offer unique education opportunities through guided tours offered to area middle and high schools
Create a learning laboratory for GSU and other University students through installation workshops and discussion opportunities
 
MSA has a history of working with sculptors, artists, art
lovers and the public through a series of annual exhibitions and conferences,
confabs and or symposiums since 2007. Venues have included Hunter Museum of
American Art, Chattanooga State Community College, University of TN, University
of Kentucky and Riverwalk Chattanooga. Past partners include LexArts, Public Art
Chattanooga, City of Chattanooga and Hamilton County. Key note speakers
and jurors have included Valerie Fletcher, Carol Mickett, Robert Stackhouse, James Surls, Jesús Moroles, Claudia DeMonte, Ed McGowin and Albert Paley.
    Perks! Perks! Perks! Donate $10 and your name will be printed in the MSA conference catalog thank you page!
Donate $25 and your name will be printed in the MSA conference catalog thank you page and receive a MSA car decal, perfect for showing of your support of art!
Donate $50 and your name will be printed in the MSA conference catalog thank you page and receive a Mid-South Conference: Atlanta 2015 poster!
Donate $75 and your name will be printed in the MSA conference catalog thank you page and receive a MSA beverage koozie, perfect for avoiding wet handshakes and warm beverages!
Donate $100 and your name will be printed in the MSA conference catalog thank you page and receive a MSA cotton duck bag, perfect for groceries, hauling your sketchbook and whatever else you can think of!
Donate $150 and  your name will be printed in the MSA conference catalog thank you page and receive the MSA swag bag! One MSA cotton duck bag loaded with the MSA car decal, beer koozie and conference poster! 
Donate $250  and your name will be printed in the MSA conference catalog thank you page and receive one free admission to all standard conference events including exhibition openings, panels, workshops and speakers! Conference is in Atlanta from September 17-20th. 
Don't want to go alone? Donate $350 your name will be printed in the MSA conference catalog thank you page and receive two free admission to all standard conference events including exhibition openings, panels, workshops and speakers! Conference is in Atlanta from September 17-20th. 
Want it all? Donate $500 and your name will be printed in the MSA catalog thank you page and receive the decal, koozie, cotton duck bag, autographed catalog, free admission for 2 to all standard conference events plus a 2 seats at the George Beasley Lifetime Achievement Dinner! 
Want to represent your business? Donate $500 and your companies name will be printed in the MSA conference catalog thank you page and your business will be highlighted in a free quarter page, camera ready ad in the MSA Sculpture Conference catalog! A great way to reach sculptors, educators and art lovers!
Need something with more impact for your business? Donate $1,000 and your companies name will be printed in the MSA conference catalog thank you page and your business will be highlighted in a free quarter page, camera ready ad in the MSA Sculpture Conference catalog! A great way to reach sculptors, educators and art lovers!

    Other Ways You Can Help We know that not everyone can contribute but you can still help support art and sculpture! Tell your friends about MSA's fundraising campaign, post it to you're social media outlets and if possible come join us for the conference in Atlanta! We would love to see you there!
Whether it is a financial donation or telling a friend about us, we can't do this without YOU!

story:
Super SWEET New Perks!

Donate $50+ and get a portrait of you drawn by Olive for the special thanks section! :D

Above is a small sample of what it'd look like. ;3 <3

Basically, I'll draw you as you'd appear in A Cup of Sugar! 

Here's a sample of the portraits; it's for my first supporter, Iris Patton!

Hey, Hello!!

Hey there! I'm Olive, a 23 year-old Philadelphia native with a (growing) red afro. I'm a fun person to hang out with-- I love video games and art and all that good stuff. A lot of my creative roots come from the animes as you could have figured, but a good majority of it came from video games. Megaman X, Crash Bandicoot, Spyro, Burnout Revenge,  and the Metroid Prime Trilogy are a few of my childhood favorites, and some of them even inspired me to do what I do! 

Recently my fiance told me about the magical world that is Long Beach Comic Con, and I've been gunning for hosting a table there as I stake my ground in the indie world. I've recently paid for the table and everything-- but now I gotta populate it.

Oh dear.

That's where YOU come in-- you super cool person. ❤

This campaign was started to help me kick off my Artist Alley debut with a BANG! Hand-crafted jewelry and art, custom prints and trinkets, smiles and laughs, and so much more are on the horizon and you can help me get there!


Okay, So Here's the Plan:

I've already paid for the registration and the Artist's Alley table. I'm also doing research to reduce costs as much as possible. Now it's a matter of teaming up with the Internet to get everything funded! CLICK HERE TO SEE WHAT I HAVE PLANNED OUT!


Ah, But I'd NEVER Forget About YOU! ;3

Supporting me gets you amazing perks that will give you +99999 fabulous points. Whadayamean that's not a real attribute? HSHSHSH

  • Secret Digital Treats!

Concept sketches, icons, patterns, and more will be readily available at your fingertips! I tend to publish secret goodies at the end of every month, so your inbox will be graced with monthly goodies! :D

I'm in the motion of scanning in my second sketch journal that will be free for YOU. <3

BONUS: Supporter-Exclusive Comics! You will be one of the lucky viewers to see A Cup of Sugar and all its bonus content!

  • YOUR NAME in a Book + Animation

Yep! I'm currently working on a novel that I will self publish to lulu.com. But wait, there's more! Your name will be in not only one, but TWO books and an ANIMATION! The first book will be a special edition of my second novel (to be published by the end of this year), and the second will be a special printed edition of a Megaman inspired comic I did this year. The animation is a promotion for my personal project TwistedFates and features the voice of Kevan Brighting (the narrator from The Stanley Parable).

  • Custom ART!

Certain Tiers will get custom art. You can get a portrait of anyone as they'd appear in my story, or if you want to get orribu'd, that's fine too. :3c

  • "I hate the word 'Swag'!"

Me too! But that's the best I can do to cover my grounds. You'll get button badges that tell the world how awesome you are, stickers, a bookmark, prints, and whatever we vote on in the course of this campaign. So far, shirts and wristbands are on the back burner.

  • What Happens If...?

If we don't raise all the funds in time, that's fine! You'll still get your prizes and smile with the knowledge that you still helped a goof like me make a great first impression on the indie artist community.

Supporters can now vote on their fave bookmark design! C:


Why You are Vital

I'll be honest-- a lot of things wouldn't be possible if not for the amazing people that support indie artists like me. You are a crucial part of getting the ball rolling. Through this campaign, I hope to create a good lasting impression at LBCC, and a good portion of making this happen comes from YOU! As you can tell this kind of stuff adds up, and my income alone can't cover it. So that's where teamwork comes in! Together we'll be an amazing team; we'll vote on designs, come up with awesome content, and so much more. We'll take the indie art world by storm! Or SOMETHING! If you guys have any suggestions or feedback, I'm open to those! I love interacting with people!

Challenge ACCEPTED!

I've got a lot of skills and what have you behind me that will prove handy during this campaign and on the convention floor. If there's one skill I can use, it's my resourcefulness. My fiance has given me good advice on how to tackle this thing, like how the first time being in an Artist's Alley isn't guaranteed to be fruitful/profitable. And you know what-- I get that. There's one thing that I can say, and that's that there's more to it than how much I can make. There's the experience of being in the mix, and that's what I'm looking most forward to.

It takes a lot of initiative and perseverance to lead a successful campaign like this, and I guarantee I'll make you guys proud. Even in my short time in the MeetUp community, for example, I've managed to lead 2 successful hangouts. It wasn't how many people attended or how much was raised, but rather the experience we sculpted together. Ask any one of the artists who attended those hangouts and they'll tell you they had a pretty good time! The same can be said for a handful of young artists who follow me on deviantART. I seem to have this magical ability to inspire people, and that alone humbles me.

Gosh, I sound like I'm running for class president or something, aren't I? Bottom line is this-- I am bound and determined to make you proud. I'll update you with each and every development, and you're free to ask me questions about the campaign, rewards, my projects, my appearance in artist's alley, or even me as a person. I love answering questions, and I'm also here to help.


"I'm SUPER Excited! But How Can I Help?"

Let me tell you-- word-of-mouth does wonders. A lot of people I follow today I wouldn't have found if not for a close friend/family member telling me about them. I remember how my friend Brittany in high school introduced me to the Angry Video Game Nerd during Italian class. Since then I've followed him and gotten a lot of laughs from his part of the internet.

You'll probably see a lot of "Draw my Life" videos where the star of the show tells people their story about their rise to Youtube fame. They usually made their videos for fun/to goof off with friends, and a lot of sharing went on and WHAM! Suddenly Markiplier descended from the heavens with his amazing manliness, genuine personality, silly videos, and gracious donations to charity. I mean.. holy SHIT I'd love to be at that point but I imagine that's not realistic. For one, you have to already be pretty godlike.

So on that note, if you don't think you can help, I'm POSITIVE you can! Use those little sharing tools on this page. Copypasta your link and tell tumblr how hilarious you think my afro looks. OR SOMETHING. . v.)/)

And that's about it, really. Gosh, thank you guys for your time and support. Let's do this thing. >:3

story:
Short Summary

We in Satellite Flight are thrilled to announce that along with our new lineup we have finished recording the first single off of our upcoming EP "Life Under The Lights".  This project was founded with artistic vision of encouraging society to step outside of their comfort zones and to really live life and experience the passion and excitement this world has to offer.  Come live under the lights with us...

What We Need & What You Get

To capture our artistic vision and message we our planning to film a throwback swing-era style music video in our hometown of Cincinnati, OH.  We will be shooting the video with award-winning music video producer Cameron Johnson.  The video will cost us $2,000.  By helping us achieve this goal and raise the funds any contributors will receive credit in the official video credits along with a series of gifts we are giving away in return for donations.

The Impact

We are living in a society that has lost touch with the idea that a passion filled life is possible for anyone.  People are born into society assuming certain dreams and aspirations are out of reach, and we want to use this project to encourage people of all backgrounds that anything is possible.

Other Ways You Can Help

Financial contributions are the most needed thing to help us accomplish this goal but if you cannot contribute financially you can still help the project by donating time as an extra in the film or items of need such as vintage vehicles, clothing, etc.

story:
Four young entrepreneur were joined by a common hobby and deep intent to see smiles of children of Gaza. So, they decided to take an action and establish their own project “Smile”.

Smile, is an entrepreneurial project which was created to make modern artistic works. Such works include modern portrays, handmade crafts and gifts.


   


We believe that bringing art to the daily lives of people can change the way that they think and react. Through colors, brushes, innovative ideas we decided to start our project.  Our goal is to create murals, handmade crafts. Smile artistic works can amend the lack of beauty in our busy daily life and the lack of green areas in our heavy crowded city.


                       

       

We see Smile murals and portrays get their way to your office, living spaces, cars, and schools everywhere to make you have that break of beauty in your busy days which gives you serenity and makes you smile. Our product, also, can be a gift from your best friend or spouse.

Our products will be available online and be delivered by a trusted company through us. Our customer is anyone who loves art, beauty, kindness and charity, as a part of our project will be dedicated to poor children and orphans in Gaza.

Our project’s goal of $1300 will be used for; marketing, promotion, operating expenses, utilities, raw materials, and a painting easel stand.

We will target everyone who is interested in beauty and in seeing a smile over faces of poor children. We working hard and hoping to see our products have the highest records, as well as achieving the charity goal. Thus we put well planned activities for this objective, such as organizing parties and trips, giving away our handmade gifts, toys, and school bags.



The impact:

We need the financial support to establish the project through buying needs, equipment and raw materials. So we can produce high quality and distinctive products to meet the elegant tastes of our customers.

Through the sale of our products and profits; 20% of our net profits will be allocated to help poor children and orphans to draw smiles over their faces. We seek to get the satisfaction of our customers so that every time a customer of ours looks at our product, they will remember these smiles.


Other ways that you can help:

We appreciate everyone's efforts at helping us. You can support by sharing our project camping among friends, colleagues and everyone who is interested at art and love charity.


*Shipping costs are not included. We will contact our supporters after we realize our campaign to arrange shipping cost and to get their contact info.

story:
What is Brunswick Nature Sculpture Walk?


Brunswick Nature Sculpture Walk brings art which raises environmental awareness to the town of Brunswick Heads 3-5 October 2015. Your money will fund invited environmental and ephemeral artists. They will bring their work from all over Australia and run free workshops to engage the local community. These artists will work with local land care groups, the community, environmental groups and schools to create installations which speak of a love for nature and art.  The first community artwork is finished, it involved 704 community members who made ceramic sea creature tiles. We have been working tirelessly behind the scenes to ensure a great event for everyone involved. But now we need your help.


Why do we need your help?

We will use the money donated to fund free workshops for the community combining art and the environment.The funds will also help artists with installation costs and fund a permanent work. This permanent work uses indigenous plants to create a unique, environmental artwork by nationally recognized artist Joanne Mott.

Here is what you will get for your money:

Check out the rewards(perks), there are ceramic tiles made by local artists, (see examples of these in images), small tours of the artworks and postcards of artworks. There will also be a lot of gratitude!

The Impact

Brunswick Nature Sculpture Walk is a dream held by local artists, community members and environmentalists. By combining art and the environment we are  bringing people to this beautiful place and giving visitors the opportunity to engage with nature and art at the same time. With your help and your donation we can build and develop this unique sculpture walk.


Other Ways You Can Help

Share, Share, Share! Either by sharing this campaign, liking and sharing our Facebook page https://www.facebook.com/BrunswickNatureSculptureWalk


and most of all, tell your friends and family!

story:
History

Historia

This project essentially formed with the intention of spreading the work of Ecuadorian musicians residing elsewhere, in this case Argentina . We want people from other parts of the world to listen and care for the cultural scene that is generated in our country.
Created by musicians from different parts of Ecuador residents in the city of Buenos Aires (Argentina), in the month of August 2015 we had the opportunity to record our compositions in Sound Rec (Buenos Aires), for what would be the first record of this assembly, what we need right now it is financial support to complete the process of disk and so this may come to light.

Este es un proyecto formado esencialmente con la intensión de difundir el trabajo de músicos ecuatorianos radicados en otros lugares, en este caso Argentina. Queremos que la gente de otras partes del mundo escuchen y se interesen por la movida cultural que se genera en nuestro país.

Creado por músicos de diferentes lugares del Ecuador residentes en la ciudad de Buenos Aires (Argentina), en el mes de Agosto del 2015 tuvimos la oportunidad de grabar nuestras composiciones en Sound Rec (Buenos Aires), para lo que seria el primer disco de este ensamble, lo que necesitamos en este momento es el apoyo financiero para poder terminar el proceso del disco y así este pueda salir a la luz.


What do we need?

Que necesitamos?


  • We need to collect a certain amount of money to make the process of finalizing our first album in the US, and achieve first class material.
  • Edition
  • Mezcla
  • Mastering
  • Desing
  • Duplicate
  • When we reach the goal set will have the opportunity to take high quality audio and DVD.

  • Necesitamos juntar una cierta cantidad de dinero para realizar el proceso de finalización de nuestro primer disco en EEUU, y lograr un material de primer nivel.
  • Edición
  • Mezcla
  • Mastering
  • Diseño
  • Duplicado
  • Cuando lleguemos a la meta propuesta tendremos la oportunidad de sacar el audio en alta calidad y un DVD.

Risks and Challenges

Riesgos y desafíos


The main difficulties which may be appearing along the way are issues of time in each process, but we are prepared to meet all the established schedule and our sponsors to deliver first class material in the dates offered.

Las principales dificultades que podrán ir apareciendo en el camino son cuestiones de tiempos en cada proceso, pero estamos preparados para poder cumplir con todo el cronograma establecido y poder entregar a nuestros auspiciantes un material de primer nivel en las fechas ofrecidas.


- Other ways you can help

- Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar
Sharing our campaign to help us reach so many more places and to meet the proposed goal.
    • Sharing our campaign to help us reach so many more places and to meet the proposed goal.
    • Ayúdanos compartiendo nuestra campaña para así llegar a muchos más lugares y poder cumplir con la meta propuesta.

story:
--------------------------------------------------------

English version at the 2nd part !

--------------------------------------------------------

# Actualité #

Le dernier numéro de la revue digitale Afrikadaa # 10 « Politics of sound » est  paru et en ligne depuis  janvier 2016.

 D’Afrikadaa # 10 naîtra une revue sonore en cohérence avec le médium même de la revue qui est le  «SON ». Ce dernier en tant que thème de prédilection, devient son support.

Nous vous avertirons, via les réseaux sociaux, c’est pour bientôt !

Photo © Satch Hoyt


-------------------------------------------


L’African Art Book Fair (AABF),  se tiendra au sein de la 12e biennale internationale d’art contemporain à Dakar. Cette manifestation repose sur une sélection d’éditeurs liés majoritairement à la production artistique du Sud, en dehors des réseaux commerciaux traditionnels. Il s’agit de publications d’artistes, de photographes, de graphistes, mais aussi de revues d’écoles d’art, de centres de recherches, de commissaires indépendants, qui se caractérisent par la vitalité des nouvelles pratiques éditoriales.


Qui sommes nous ?

Nous sommes un collectif d’artistes, de curateurs, d’adhérents et de sympathisants engagés dans à la promotion et la visibilité de l’art contemporain.


Description du projet

Nouvellement fondé, l’African Art Book Fair  soutien  la production critique dans les territoires du sud, sur la scène internationale.

L’African Art Book Fait convoque et questionne les différents formats d’écriture, de contenus esthétiques et de toute publication relative à l’art contemporain. Elle vise à collaborer avec les institutions internationales et les individus concernés par la production dans le domaine de l'art contemporain d’Afrique, le design, l'architecture, la conception et l'édition.

Numéros de la revue d’art AFRIKADAA déjà parus


Pourquoi c’est important ?

 Nous y serons  à la  12e biennale internationale d’art contemporain à Dakar, pour célébrer le sens,  l’écrit, le verbe, rassembler et construire l’histoire et consolider la mémoire de l’art contemporain du Sud.

Le commissaire de la biennale de Dakar, Simon Njami, par sa posture même d’écrivain, du thème et de ses choix éditoriaux affichés  lors de cette  biennale, souligne  une carence - certaine - de l’écrit au sein de cette biennale et ce depuis 24 années.

L’année 2016, correspond au 50e anniversaire du Festival mondial de  l’Art Nègre,  dont la première édition  s’est déroulé à Dakar, et fût organisé par l’État sénégalais dirigé par Léopold Sédar Senghor, quelques années après l’accès à l’indépendance de la plupart des pays africains, cet événement célébrait, pour la première fois en Afrique, la créativité et la diversité des arts et des pensées du continent et de ses diasporas. Le lien est flagrant pour s’en saisir !!

Le projet de l’African Art Book Fair, s’est imposé à nous comme une évidence  pour convoquer et questionner les différents formats d’écriture, de contenus esthétiques et de toute publication relative à l’art contemporain.

L’African Art Book Fair vise à collaborer avec les institutions internationales et les individus concernés par la production dans le domaine de l’art contemporain d’Afrique, le design, l’architecture et l’édition. Tisser les liens de  compréhension des enjeux  ici et maintenant pendant Dak’art rassemblant des pièces venues d’ici et là.

Voir ici : S’inscrire à la première édition d’African Art Book Fair


Nos besoins

Pour mener à bien cette  première édition de l’African Art Book Fair, qui se tiendra à Dakar du 04 au 08 mai 2016,  au sein  de la 12e biennale  Dak’art nous avons besoin de votre engagement à défendre les artistes,  de  bienveillance et  votre aide.

Nous avons  besoin de votre soutien financier

Une aide financière est indispensable pour réaliser une foire de 20 exposants,  d’un panel de discussion, d’une exposition, de « Workshop »  et d’une série d’évènements quotidiens, comme des «Open Talk»,  espace de prise de parole mis à la disposition  aux exposants pendant l’AABF.

Voici : Programme de l’AABF


Contreparties

Pour vous remercier de nous financier, nous préparons des cadeaux pour les donateurs  …


1. À partir de 10€ : un badge + notre reconnaissance éternelle

Le badge est une démonstration de notre amitié éternelle

2. À partir de 20€ : un tote bag de Laurence Airline

Un cadeau spécial offert par notre partenaire designer Laurence Airline


3. À partir de 50€ : une passe du Musée Dapper

Une offre de notre partenaire Musée Dapper Paris : une entrée gratuite à l’exposition « Chefs-d'oeuvre d’Afrique » dans les collections du musée jusqu’au 17 juillet 2016 au Musée Dapper Paris.


4. À partir de 100€ : une rencontre avec un artiste

Une conversation agréable autour de l’univers de l'artiste


5. À partir de 200€ : un livre « Brésil, l'héritage africain » 

Aux éditions Dapper 


6. À partir de 500€ : adhésion au « Cercle »

Amis d’Afrikadaa Paris pendant 1 an


7. À partir de 1,000€ : amis privilégiés du grand cercle

Votre nom sur le site de l' « African Art Book Fair », sur le catalogue, etc.


Attention !

Cette fonction de paiement est offerte par Paypal. Vous pouvez régler avec votre compte Paypal ou par votre carte bancaire. Si votre carte (son numéro) est refusée, connectez-vous d’abord  à votre compte Paypal puis payer ou créer votre compte propre. 

Les numéros de carte sont refusés parce que :

1. Cette carte est liée à un compte Paypal existant.
2. Cette carte est utilisée à payer via Paypal sans connexion plus de 4 fois.

Si vous avez encore des problèmes de paiement en ligne, merci de régler par virement avec les informations ci-dessous et nous écrire à contact@africanartbookfair.com :

AFRIKADAA
11 RUE DES MIGNOTTES 75019 PARIS
IBAN – FR 62 20041 00001 6801310J020 02
BIC – PSSTFRPPPAR

Nous vous  remercions de contribuer à la première édition d’AABF d’exister lors de la 12e biennale internationale de Dakar / Dak’Art 2016.


Impact

African Art Book Fair (AABF), présente les éditeurs d’art indépendants. C’est le premier salon du genre en Afrique. L’AABF comprend plus de 20 éditeurs internationaux, avec un accent particulier sur les publications et les approches expérimentales de l'édition, l'impression et l'écriture d'artistes.

La genèse de ce projet date de la biennale de Dakar de 2014, au regard à la fois de la carence de l’écrit et de la critique et du regain de la circulation des œuvres d’art contemporain Africain, dans le monde et sa présence dans les principales manifestations.


Pour réaliser ce projet un travail de prospection, consultation et conseil a été mené avec partage et passion et engagement pour l’amour de l’art…

1. Nous avons sélectionné des éditeurs

Le choix de la programmation repose sur une sélection de publications, d’éditeurs, d’artistes dont la pertinence de l’offre est en relation avec l'état actuel du monde, par ses composantes, technologique, esthétique, critique, géopolitique et environnementale. Toute une richesse !

Plusieurs éditeurs indépendants issus de l’Afrique et de l’Amérique du Sud ne peuvent pas venir car le coût des billets d’avion est trop élevé.

La solution de cette difficulté et de faire venir leur publications et de faire appel à des bénévoles engagés sur place, grâce à notre travail de lien sur le terrain


2. Nous avons établi une programmation

Des invités de choix, vont montrer, analyser, discuter de plusieurs productions différentes qui vont souligner la qualité de la production éditoriale en termes de forme et de contenu.


3. Nous avons invité des artistes, des curateurs, des médiateurs pour animer ces journées de foire

Le fait que ce milieu de l’édition soit sinistré, a rendu difficile le déplacement des éditeurs sur le plan financier, en dépit de l’intérêt pour la manifestation. D’ailleurs les les institutions n’ont pas répondu à notre requête d’être financé en partie.

Notre collectif est bénévole, les projets que nous menons, sont portés par notre passion de défendre l’art et la critique.


Aujourd’hui, nous sommes à quelques jours de la biennale, et plus que jamais, nous avons besoin de votre soutien !

1. Nous sollicitons des partenaires à différents niveaux de collaboration pour permettre à cette foire d’exister

2. Une fois la collecte honorée, nous partirons à Dakar pour mettre en place cette foire du livre en terme de dispositifs, de stands et de finaliser la communication

Cette foire d’art du livre permettra au publique et aux professionnels du monde de l art de découvrir les meilleurs publications qui se font sur le continent Africain.

Favoriser l’échange et les circulations des savoirs. Les éditeurs indépendants pourront échanger et faire découvrir leurs dernières publications.


D'autres façons d'aider


1. Nous sommes à recherche de bénévoles qui pourront assurer sur place une aide.

Voir ici : Appel aux bénévoles


2. Nous comptons sur votre bienveillance pour nous aider de deux manières :

  • Parler de nous et donner nos contacts
  • Faites circuler l’information de l’African Art Book Fair 
  • Partager les Crowdfunding avec vos proches (familles et amis), les inviter à aimer notre page et la partager pour faire connaître notre action bénévole

Notre page Facebook www.facebook.com/africanartbookfair
Notre Twitter twitter.com/AfricanArtBook
Notre Instagram www.instagram.com/africanartbook


3.  Financièrement en adhérant à notre formule et vous serez remercié et récompensé

Cette foire d’ art du livre permettra au public et aux professionnels du monde de l’art de découvrir les meilleurs publications qui se font sur le continent africain.

Favoriser l’échange et les circulations des savoirs. Les éditeurs indépendants feront découvrir leurs dernières publications.

L’AABF, se positionne en tant qu’une entité itinérante qui s’invitera au sein des foires, salons, et biennales. La carence de la production critique menace aujourd’hui la transmission de l’art contemporain d’Afrique et ses diasporas, en termes de contenu critique, d’analyse. L’AABF traversera les frontières afin de confirmer la nécessité incontournable de s’inscrire dans l’écrit et le sens et de mémoriser des formes nouvelles et contemporaines.


AABF du 04 au 8 mai, pendant la 12e biennale de Dakar


--------------------------------------------------------

English version

--------------------------------------------------------


The magazine Afrikadaa and its partners propose to unite all african and diasporic art publications to allow for the dissemination and exchange of experiences between the editorial productions through the sharing of knowledge and practice. 



African Art Book Fair (AABF)™ /1re édition

At the  Dakar Biennale

May 4th to 8th – 2016


African Art Book Fair (AABF) is an art publication fair with a discussion forum concentrating on themes linked to art publications, photography, design, experimental music, open culture and activism. By underlining the best practices of these domains, we aim to offer to the members of these communities a context in which they can maintain their integrity, their critical voice and their social role when faced with external factors (the market, urbanism, or media…). 

By recognizing and supporting unique and qualitative editorial practices African Art Book Fair wants to open up to a larger public, and put them in contact with the publishers, offline and online. The intersection between the different esthetic production fields is an integral part of the process. We want to put forward the editorial practices and the physicality of the book, as a medium and in its transcription towards other forms of media. 



The making of an art book fair during the Dakar Biennale! 

Given that the fields of editing and publication in art are under-represented, Afrikadaa and its partners are offering to unite all African and diaspora art publications in order to allow for various types of experiential exchange between the editorial productions. We wish to contribute to the development of an editorial pole of art by working on the creation of an African Art Book Fair (AABF), on the African continent. 

The idea to create an AABF that included all African contemporary Art organizations resulted from discussions at the symposium “Memory of the future,” organized by Afrikadaa during the last Dakar Biennale in 2014. Afrikadaa underlined the importance of defending the critical production and witnessing the evolution of an artistic period, especially in a context where we see that the desertion of writing will leave a huge hole in the construction of its history. Furthermore, Afrikadaa underlined the importance of relaying this information to future generations. The voluntary or unintentional eviction of books from biennales, art fairs, and other artistic events in Africa and the absence of magazines from the South in large international fairs, means there is an absence of critical content, esthetic debates about their times, and confrontations (sociological and ideological) of their work. This truly impoverishes the artistic world as a whole. Because of the drowning of the publication sector in Africa, we must encourage and uplift it through strong initiatives. We must encourage content worthy of critical acclaim, standard works, and artist books and unite to celebrate them during a fair dedicated to their existence. 

In partnership with the Dakar Biennale, the African Art Book Fair and Raw Material are glad to present the first edition of this international art book Fair from May 2nd to 8th 2016, during the Dak’art Biennale. 

African Art Book Fair  (AABF), offers a panel of large independent art editors from various countries in Africa, the Caribbean, the Americas and Europe. The AABF is the first exhibit of this type in Africa, and welcomes more than 30 international editors and spotlights publications offering experimental approaches to publishing, writing and the printing of works. 

The African Art Book Fair was founded very recently, and underlines the production and distribution of art publishing, a relatively new domain that has become an essential part of contemporary art in the last few years. It is imperative that these efforts are supported on the continent of Africa. The art edition includes images and text in the experimental form of artist books, art writing and magazines collectively edited, critical revues, and photography books. In this fertile field, the work of international artists is made available to the public through affordable editions, while offering an alternative to biennales, galleries, and museums. 

African Art Book Fair was founded by a group of artists and art critics who were worried about the production of critique in southern territories, and who were engaged in art publication in the international scene. 

The team : Hafida Jemni, Camille Moulonguet, Pascale Obolo and Jay Ramier, Lucy Topaloff, and Stephanie Bonnet (and support from its members). 

The African Art Book Fair questions the different ways of writing the esthetic contents of all contemporary art publications. It strives to collaborate with international institutions and individuals interested in the production of African contemporary art, design, architecture, conception, and publishing. 

The program was chosen by a select group of publications, editors, and artists who are in touch with the current state of the world, its technology, esthetic, critique, geopolitics and environment. This is a huge richness! 

This art book fair will allow the public and professionals in the art world to discover the best publications on the African continent. It will encourage exchange of knowledge. Independent publishers will be able to sell and show their latest publications. 



Program of the presentations at the African Art Book Fair 2016


1° - Opening 

Coktail/ Art Opening Date: May 4th 2016, 5 p.m.


2° Discussion Panel 

Theme : What are international art book fairs for ?

Participants : Offprint director, 

Date : May 4th 2016

Place : In partnership with the Dak’art « In »


3° - Discussion Panel

Theme : Publication Acts  examines the link between publishing of artist books to other forms of art, graphic design and commisions. The chosen panelists use multiform practices that offer a critical vision between these worlds. 

Participants : Kulte Edition (Yasmine Naji) et la Maison d’édition Vives Voix and other independent publishers, and surprise artists 

Moderator : Camille Moulonguet

Date : May 5th 2016


4° - Discussion Panel

Theme : Presentation on the artist book  

This session was created to promote the excellence, dialogue and enthusiasm around artist books 

Participants : Kader Attia ; Kai Lossgott ; Jean-Pierre Dekolo

Moderator : Hafida Jemni (Afrikadaa)


5° - Discussion Panel

Theme : Print like Matter

« Print artists and conservators», will be to explore how the printed text and image become materials for creating new works, while the artist book and magazine are works in and of themselves. 

Participants (in process) : Pascale Obolo (Afrikadaa), Mario Pissaro (ASAI), Bonnaventure (Savvy) 

Moderator : Syham Weigant (rédactrice en chef de Diptyk)

Date : May 6th 2016


6° - Discussion Panel

Theme : Discussion around the exhibit « la Revue Noire au Manège »

Intervenants :Simon Njami, Jean-Lou Pivin

Date : 7 mai 2016


7° Discussion Panel

Theme : What are the stakes of the critical production in Southern territories

Participants (in progress) : Mario Pissaro (ASAI), AlleysonmeKulte Edition, Chimurenga, ArtAfrica, Black Renaissance, Afrikadaa, Alleyesonme, Diptyk

Followed by a Q&A with the public. 

Moderator : Alix Koffy (OFF the wall)

Date : May 7th 2016


8° Workshop

Production workshop with the artist Jay One 

Date : From May 3rd to 8th 2016


9° Daily Event

Aperitif/lecture with a selection of artists, every day at 5 p.m. 

Open Talk: space dedicated to presentation. Independent publishers and chief director can sign up to present their magazine or book 

Exhibit : Live edictorial act of the Afrikadaa Journal (Curator : Afrikadaa)


List of participants


Amalion publishing (Sénégal) 

Vives Voix (Sénégal) -

Actes Sud  (France)

Afrikadaa (France / Sénégal) 

ARC Magazine (Caraibean) 

ASAI (South Africa),

Diptyk (Maroc)

Black Renaissance Noire (US)

ArtAfrica (South Africa)    

IAM (Netherlands/Cameroon)

Contemporay &And (Germany)

Savvy- journal (Germany)

BOMB Magazine (US) (in current) 

OFF the wall (Ivory Coast /France)

La revue All eyez on me  (Ivory Coast /France)

Revue Noire publication (France)

CNAEI (France)

Editions de l’œil (France) 

 Onomatopee (Netherlands)

Art Departure (US)

Nous vous  remercions de contribuer à la première édition d’AABF d’exister lors de la 12e biennale internationale de Dakar / Dak’Art 2016.

Impact
African Art Book Fair (AABF), présente les éditeurs d’art indépendants. C’est le premier salon du genre en Afrique. L’AABF comprend plus de 20 éditeurs internationaux, avec un accent particulier sur les publications et les approches expérimentales de l'édition, l'impression et l'écriture d'artistes.
La genèse de ce projet date de la biennale de Dakar de 2014, au regard à la fois de la carence de l’écrit et de la critique et du regain de la circulation des œuvres d’art contemporain Africain, dans le monde et sa présence dans les principales manifestations.

Pour réaliser ce projet un travail de prospection, consultation et conseil a été mené avec partage et passion et engagement pour l’amour de l’art…
1. Nous avons sélectionné des éditeurs
Le choix de la programmation repose sur une sélection de publications, d’éditeurs, d’artistes dont la pertinence de l’offre est en relation avec l'état actuel du monde, par ses composantes, technologique, esthétique, critique, géopolitique et environnementale. Toute une richesse !
Plusieurs éditeurs indépendants issus de l’Afrique et de l’Amérique du Sud ne peuvent pas venir car le coût des billets d’avion est trop élevé.
La solution de cette difficulté et de faire venir leur publications et de faire appel à des bénévoles engagés sur place, grâce à notre travail de lien sur le terrain

2. Nous avons établi une programmation
Des invités de choix, vont montrer, analyser, discuter de plusieurs productions différentes qui vont souligner la qualité de la production éditoriale en termes de forme et de contenu.

3. Nous avons invité des artistes, des curateurs, des médiateurs pour animer ces journées de foire
Le fait que ce milieu de l’édition soit sinistré, a rendu difficile le déplacement des éditeurs sur le plan financier, en dépit de l’intérêt pour la manifestation. D’ailleurs les les institutions n’ont pas répondu à notre requête d’être financé en partie.
Notre collectif est bénévole, les projets que nous menons, sont portés par notre passion de défendre l’art et la critique.

Aujourd’hui, nous sommes à quelques jours de la biennale, et plus que jamais, nous avons besoin de votre soutien !
1. Nous sollicitons des partenaires à différents niveaux de collaboration pour permettre à cette foire d’exister
2. Une fois la collecte honorée, nous partirons à Dakar pour mettre en place cette foire du livre en terme de dispositifs, de stands et de finaliser la communication
Cette foire d’art du livre permettra au publique et aux professionnels du monde de l art de découvrir les meilleurs publications qui se font sur le continent Africain.
Favoriser l’échange et les circulations des savoirs. Les éditeurs indépendants pourront échanger et faire découvrir leurs dernières publications.

D'autres façons d'aider

1. Nous sommes à recherche de bénévoles qui pourront assurer sur place une aide.
Voir ici : Appel aux bénévoles

2. Nous comptons sur votre bienveillance pour nous aider de deux manières :

Faites circuler l’information de l’African Art Book Fair 
Partager les Crowdfunding avec vos proches (familles et amis), les inviter à aimer notre page et la partager pour faire connaître notre action bénévole

Notre page Facebook www.facebook.com/africanartbookfairNotre Twitter twitter.com/AfricanArtBookNotre Instagram www.instagram.com/africanartbook

3.  Financièrement en adhérant à notre formule et vous serez remercié et récompensé
Cette foire d’ art du livre permettra au public et aux professionnels du monde de l’art de découvrir les meilleurs publications qui se font sur le continent africain.
Favoriser l’échange et les circulations des savoirs. Les éditeurs indépendants feront découvrir leurs dernières publications.
L’AABF, se positionne en tant qu’une entité itinérante qui s’invitera au sein des foires, salons, et biennales. La carence de la production critique menace aujourd’hui la transmission de l’art contemporain d’Afrique et ses diasporas, en termes de contenu critique, d’analyse. L’AABF traversera les frontières afin de confirmer la nécessité incontournable de s’inscrire dans l’écrit et le sens et de mémoriser des formes nouvelles et contemporaines.

AABF du 04 au 8 mai, pendant la 12e biennale de Dakar

English version
--------------------------------------------------------
The magazine Afrikadaa and its partners propose to unite all african and diasporic art publications to allow for the dissemination and exchange of experiences between the editorial productions through the sharing of knowledge and practice. 





African Art Book Fair (AABF)™ /1re édition
At the  Dakar Biennale
May 4th to 8th – 2016


African Art Book Fair (AABF) is an art publication fair with a discussion forum concentrating on themes linked to art publications, photography, design, experimental music, open culture and activism. By underlining the best practices of these domains, we aim to offer to the members of these communities a context in which they can maintain their integrity, their critical voice and their social role when faced with external factors (the market, urbanism, or media…). 
By recognizing and supporting unique and qualitative editorial practices African Art Book Fair wants to open up to a larger public, and put them in contact with the publishers, offline and online. The intersection between the different esthetic production fields is an integral part of the process. We want to put forward the editorial practices and the physicality of the book, as a medium and in its transcription towards other forms of media. 




The making of an art book fair during the Dakar Biennale! 
Given that the fields of editing and publication in art are under-represented, Afrikadaa and its partners are offering to unite all African and diaspora art publications in order to allow for various types of experiential exchange between the editorial productions. We wish to contribute to the development of an editorial pole of art by working on the creation of an African Art Book Fair (AABF), on the African continent. 
The idea to create an AABF that included all African contemporary Art organizations resulted from discussions at the symposium “Memory of the future,” organized by Afrikadaa during the last Dakar Biennale in 2014. Afrikadaa underlined the importance of defending the critical production and witnessing the evolution of an artistic period, especially in a context where we see that the desertion of writing will leave a huge hole in the construction of its history. Furthermore, Afrikadaa underlined the importance of relaying this information to future generations. The voluntary or unintentional eviction of books from biennales, art fairs, and other artistic events in Africa and the absence of magazines from the South in large international fairs, means there is an absence of critical content, esthetic debates about their times, and confrontations (sociological and ideological) of their work. This truly impoverishes the artistic world as a whole. Because of the drowning of the publication sector in Africa, we must encourage and uplift it through strong initiatives. We must encourage content worthy of critical acclaim, standard works, and artist books and unite to celebrate them during a fair dedicated to their existence. 
In partnership with the Dakar Biennale, the African Art Book Fair and Raw Material are glad to present the first edition of this international art book Fair from May 2nd to 8th 2016, during the Dak’art Biennale. 
African Art Book Fair  (AABF), offers a panel of large independent art editors from various countries in Africa, the Caribbean, the Americas and Europe. The AABF is the first exhibit of this type in Africa, and welcomes more than 30 international editors and spotlights publications offering experimental approaches to publishing, writing and the printing of works. 
The African Art Book Fair was founded very recently, and underlines the production and distribution of art publishing, a relatively new domain that has become an essential part of contemporary art in the last few years. It is imperative that these efforts are supported on the continent of Africa. The art edition includes images and text in the experimental form of artist books, art writing and magazines collectively edited, critical revues, and photography books. In this fertile field, the work of international artists is made available to the public through affordable editions, while offering an alternative to biennales, galleries, and museums. 
African Art Book Fair was founded by a group of artists and art critics who were worried about the production of critique in southern territories, and who were engaged in art publication in the international scene. 
The team : Hafida Jemni, Camille Moulonguet, Pascale Obolo and Jay Ramier, Lucy Topaloff, and Stephanie Bonnet (and support from its members). 
The African Art Book Fair questions the different ways of writing the esthetic contents of all contemporary art publications. It strives to collaborate with international institutions and individuals interested in the production of African contemporary art, design, architecture, conception, and publishing. 
The program was chosen by a select group of publications, editors, and artists who are in touch with the current state of the world, its technology, esthetic, critique, geopolitics and environment. This is a huge richness! 
This art book fair will allow the public and professionals in the art world to discover the best publications on the African continent. It will encourage exchange of knowledge. Independent publishers will be able to sell and show their latest publications. 




Program of the presentations at the African Art Book Fair 2016


1° - Opening 
Coktail/ Art Opening Date: May 4th 2016, 5 p.m.

2° Discussion Panel 
Theme : What are international art book fairs for ?
Participants : Offprint director, 
Date : May 4th 2016
Place : In partnership with the Dak’art « In »

3° - Discussion Panel
Theme : Publication Acts  examines the link between publishing of artist books to other forms of art, graphic design and commisions. The chosen panelists use multiform practices that offer a critical vision between these worlds. 
Participants : Kulte Edition (Yasmine Naji) et la Maison d’édition Vives Voix and other independent publishers, and surprise artists 
Moderator : Camille Moulonguet
Date : May 5th 2016

4° - Discussion Panel
Theme : Presentation on the artist book  
This session was created to promote the excellence, dialogue and enthusiasm around artist books 
Participants : Kader Attia ; Kai Lossgott ; Jean-Pierre Dekolo
Moderator : Hafida Jemni (Afrikadaa)

5° - Discussion Panel
Theme : Print like Matter
« Print artists and conservators», will be to explore how the printed text and image become materials for creating new works, while the artist book and magazine are works in and of themselves. 
Participants (in process) : Pascale Obolo (Afrikadaa), Mario Pissaro (ASAI), Bonnaventure (Savvy) 
Moderator : Syham Weigant (rédactrice en chef de Diptyk)
Date : May 6th 2016

6° - Discussion Panel
Theme : Discussion around the exhibit « la Revue Noire au Manège »
Intervenants :Simon Njami, Jean-Lou Pivin
Date : 7 mai 2016

7° Discussion Panel
Theme : What are the stakes of the critical production in Southern territories
Participants (in progress) : Mario Pissaro (ASAI), AlleysonmeKulte Edition, Chimurenga, ArtAfrica, Black Renaissance, Afrikadaa, Alleyesonme, Diptyk
Followed by a Q&A with the public. 
Moderator : Alix Koffy (OFF the wall)
Date : May 7th 2016

8° Workshop
Production workshop with the artist Jay One 
Date : From May 3rd to 8th 2016

9° Daily Event
Aperitif/lecture with a selection of artists, every day at 5 p.m. 
Open Talk: space dedicated to presentation. Independent publishers and chief director can sign up to present their magazine or book 
Exhibit : Live edictorial act of the Afrikadaa Journal (Curator : Afrikadaa)
